not apply to any premises licensed continuously since  nor shall this subsection apply to the issuance of temporary special event fermented malt beverage licenses c the manufacture andor sale of alcohol beverages covered by this chapter is declared to be a business this chapter shall not extend or waive in any manner the requirements of the zoning ordinance the requirements of the zoning ordinance shall be construed as a further limitation on the granting of licenses under this chapter   part 1982 licenses  granted  issued  issuance extensions  extension fees  payment of license when a no alcohol beverage license may be granted by the city council unless the applicant has filed a written application on the required forms showing that the applicant is qualified to be licensed and that the premises may lawfully be used for the purpose intended no alcohol beverage license may be issued unless the applicant has paid the license fee in an amount as established by the city council from time to time and as set out in the fee schedule that appears in this b no alcohol beverage license may be issued by the city clerk until such license is granted by the city council no alcohol beverage license except a temporary special event fermented malt beverage license may be issued until the city clerk has been shown proof of application for a federal special tax stamp and the premises are inspected and approved by the health department the fire department and the building inspection department c each applicant who has been granted a license to sell alcohol by the city council shall pay the applicable license fee in full to the city clerktreasurer within 15 days of the date the license was granted the date a granted alcohol license is to be issued shall be deemed no later than the 15th calendar day after the date the license is granted not counting the date of the grant any failure to timely pay the applicable alcohol license fee in full voids the granted license and renders it of no further force or effect without the necessity of any further action review or notice by the city council any applicant whose granted license has been voided under the provisions of this section may not rely upon any previously submitted application for the same premises but shall reapply de novo and follow the procedure required for a new license application d each applicant who has been granted an original license to sell alcohol by the city council shall have a period of 240 days to open after the initial 240day period the licensee may request one or more extensions of time within which to satisfy all conditions precedent andor subsequent established by statute ordinance policy statement andor special condition imposed by the alcohol license advisory committee andor city council for issuance of the license each extension request shall be in writing accompanied by a nonrefundable extension request fee which will be in an amount as established by the city council from time to time and set forth in the fee schedule that appears in this fee shall be payable to and filed with the city clerktreasurer no extension request shall be considered or acted upon without a filed written application payment of the extension fee and payment in full of all alcohol fee granting an extension is completely discretionary is a privilege is not a right and may be granted if good cause and reasonable necessity are found by the alcohol license advisory committee in which body the authority to review and grant extensions shall be vested an extension may be granted for a period of time not to exceed 90 consecutive days the exact duration subject to the discretion of the alcohol license advisory committee a total of three extensions may be requested and granted if the applicant follows the procedure set forth herein and timely applies and pays the fee for consideration no later than the 15th day of the month preceding the current extensions expiration date the alcohol license advisory committee may grant extensions beyond the total of three if the alcohol license advisory committee finds the precedent or subsequent conditions cannot be met because of a natural disaster in the event that an applicant fails to comply with any provision of this chapter or an extension expires without the issuance of a granted license or without a timely applied for and approved subsequent extension such granted license shall be void and rendered of no further force or effect without the necessity of any further action review or notice by the city council any applicant whose granted license has been voided under the provisions of this subsection may not rely upon any previously submitted application for the same premises but shall reapply de novo and follow the procedure required for a new license application e all fees paid hereunder are nonrefundable   part 1982  ii 11272017   ii 11262018   i 482019  i 10142019  fermented malt beverage licenses  intoxicating liquor licenses a specific licenses for the sale of fermented malt beverages are authorized in this chapter b specific licenses for the sale of intoxicating liquor are authorized in this chapter  licensee responsible the licensee or agent for a corporate licensee shall be personally responsible for the faithful observance and performance by himself or herself and all the licensees employees agents or representatives engaged in or about the licensed premises of all the conditions and provisions of this chapter of wis stats ch 125 and of any ordinance of the city and law of the state which may in any way relate directly to the business conducted by such licensee a violation of any such ordinance or law by the licensees employees agents or representatives constitutes a violation by the licensee the licensee shall be responsible for the payment of any forfeiture or penalties assessed against the licensee or against such licensees employees agents or representatives while acting for or on behalf of the licensee   part 1982 corporate alcohol license agent  resident of rock county the alcohol license agent for a corporation holding any alcohol license within the city shall be a resident of rock county    1987 operators license required  applications  term  expiration  fee  review  issuance  provisional license a operator bartender license required no premises operated under a class a class b or class c license may be open for business unless there is upon the premises either the licensee the agent named in the license if the licensee is a corporation or some person who has an operators license and who is responsible for the acts of all persons selling or serving any alcohol beverages to customers for the purpose of this subsection any member of a licensees immediate family 18 years of age or older shall be considered the holder of an operators license b regular operators license 1 operator bartender licenses may be issued only upon written application 2 submitted applications shall be referred by the city clerk to the police department for review and recommendation the police department shall review each submitted application and recommend issuance or denial of the license 3 the city clerk shall issue a regular operator bartender license to an applicant if the police department recommends issuance and the applicant is in compliance with all other requirements the city clerk shall deny issuance of a regular operator bartender license to an applicant when the police department recommends denial 4 if an application is denied the city clerk denial shall be in writing and shall set forth the reason for the denial a an applicant may appeal a denial to the alcohol license advisory committee alac the appeal must be in writing setting forth the reason for the appeal signed and dated by the applicant and filed with the city clerk within 30 days of the date of denial written appeals that conform to the requirements set forth in this chapter shall be copied and forwarded to the alac by the city clerk the clerk shall provide written notice to the appellant of the date time and place of the alac meeting at which the appeal will be considered the alac shall conduct a hearing upon the appeal the applicant may appear be represented and present evidence and witnesses the alac shall decide by majority of those voting whether to overrule the administrative denial abstaining is not a vote the alac may attach conditions and limitations to a granted operator license appeals that do not conform to these requirements shall not be considered by the alac b an alac decision upholding denial may be appealed to the city council and shall also be in writing setting forth the reason for the appeal signed and dated by the applicant and filed with the city clerk within 30 days of the date of denial written appeals that conform to the requirements set forth in this chapter shall be copied and forwarded to the city council by the city clerk the clerk shall provide written notice to the appellant of the date time and place of the city council meeting at which the appeal will be considered the city council shall conduct a hearing upon the appeal the applicant may appear be represented and present evidence and witnesses the hearing shall be recorded the city council shall decide by majority of those voting whether to overrule the administrative denial abstaining is not a vote the city council may attach conditions and limitations to a granted operator license appeals that do not conform to these requirements shall not be considered by the city council 5 a submitted application that is incomplete or which contains false or misleading information must be denied and the applicant must wait six months before submitting another application c provisional operators license the city clerk shall issue a provisional operators license to any person who has his or her provisional license application approved by the police department no provisional operators license shall be issued prior to approval of the applicant by the police department 1 a provisional operators license shall not be issued to any person whose regular or provisional operators license has ever previously been denied or revoked by the city a provisional operators license shall be void ab initio and of no force or effect if issued to any person whose regular or provisional operators license has ever previously been denied or revoked by the city misuse of a provisional operators license by an applicant shall constitute operation without a license and a violation of this chapter 2 a provisional operators license is valid for a period not to exceed 60 days from the date of issuance by the city clerk or until a regular operators license is issued to the applicant by the city clerk whichever occurs first 3 the city clerk may revoke any provisional license in the event that the city clerk finds that the holder of such license made any false misleading or incomplete statement on his or her application or that the applicant has previously had his or her regular or provisional license denied or revoked by the city d regular and provisional operator license fee the fee for an original or renewed operators license and a provisional operators license shall be in an amount as established by the city council from time to time and as set out in the fee schedule that appears in this fee shall be prorated original and renewed operator licenses shall expire on june 30th of each oddnumbered year e temporary operators license pursuant to wis stats  125174 the city clerk shall issue a temporary operators license to any individual that meets the criteria in b of this section and is employed by or donating their services to nonprofit corporations 1 no person may hold more than two licenses of this kind per year 2 the license is valid for any period from one day to 14 days and the period for which it is valid shall be stated on the license 3 the fee for a temporary operators license shall be in an amount as established by the city council from time to time and as set out in the fee schedule that appears in this  license  posting required every person licensed to sell alcohol beverages under this chapter shall immediately post such license and keep the same posted while in force in a conspicuous place in the licensed premises an operator shall post his or her license in the licensed premises where he or she is employed or shall carry such license on his or her person while on duty   part 1982  part 1987 transfer of license location every alcohol beverage license may be transferred to another location within the same municipality subject to city council approval and the payment of a transfer fee which shall be in an amount as established by the city council from time to time and as set out in the fee schedule that appears in this city council may refuse to approve the transfer if it finds that the proposed location is not acceptable because of zoning or noncompliance with a state or local law or regulation or that the establishment of licensed premises at the proposed location would adversely affect the neighborhood local residents or the general welfare of the citizens of the city   part 1982  part 1987 access requirements  licensed premises separate from retail stores  no other business on licensed premises  exceptions a no class a or class b license may be granted or issued unless there is access to the licensed premises directly from the street or sidewalk or from public hallways or stairways of any public building or area open to the public no access to the licensed premises may be permitted premises of any other business whether owned by the licensee or a different individual if the licensed premises are located in a complex of retail stores the licensed premises shall be separated from the other retail areas by solid walls of rigid construction no openings are allowed in such walls 1 this restriction shall not apply to hotels and motels having more than 30 rooms which are equipped and in use for rental to guests as sleeping quarters nor to bowling alleys 2 also exempt are combination grocery storesrestaurants but only the restaurant portion may hold an alcohol license and then only a class b beer only andor class c wine only license the grocery storeactivities must be separate from the restaurantalcohol licensed portion and activities by solid walls that may have one passage between the two uses so as to permit the use of a single restroom facility by all patrons all alcohol sales and consumption shall only occur on the licensed restaurant premises storage of alcohol shall occur only upon a licensed portion of the premises which may include a noncontiguous area apart from the restaurant portion no sales shall occur for offpremises consumption notwithstanding anything in the statutes or ordinances to the contrary 3 also exempt are grocery stores and supermarkets that hold a class a license and whose business is other than the sale of petroleum based products or pharmaceutical products provided that the total floor area for display and sales of all class a products for sale in the establishment does not exceed 80 square feet is contiguous and confined to said area and with the ability to be physically and effectively separate and lock that portion of the premises so as to render it inaccessible to customers and other nonprivileged persons during nonsale hours as those are defined in  b no other business may be conducted on the licensed premises this restriction shall not apply to 1 food service on class b premises  2 selling wrapped food pursuant to a city food license on class a licensed premises  3 a bowling alley movie theater pool hall dart lanes for hand thrown darts or enclosed archery lanes  4 hotels and motels having more than 30 rooms which are equipped and in use for rental to guests as sleeping quarters  5 combination grocery storerestaurants that hold a class b beer only andor class c wine only license for the restaurant portion but only the restaurant portion may hold an alcohol license the grocery storeactivities must be separate from the restaurantalcohol licensed portion and activities by solid walls that may have one passage between the two uses so as to permit the use of a single restroom facility by all patrons storage of alcohol shall occur only upon a licensed portion of the premises which may include a noncontiguous area apart from the restaurant portion all alcohol sales and consumption shall only occur on the licensed restaurant premises no sales shall occur for offpremises consumption notwithstanding anything in the statutes or ordinances to the contrary  6 retail establishments that have as their principal business the sale of materials supplies and ingredients directly related to homebrewing of fermented malt beverages and winemaking that hold a class a license  7 grocery stores and supermarkets that hold a class a license and whose business is other than the sale of petroleum based products or pharmaceutical products provided that the total floor area for display and sales of all class a products for sale in the establishment does not exceed 80 square feet is contiguous and confined to said area and with the ability to be physically and effectively separate and lock that portion of the premises so as to render it inaccessible to customers and other nonprivileged persons during nonsale hours as those are defined in  c temporary special event fermented malt beverage licensees are exempt from the requirements of this section   i 9232019 inspection authorized  removal of unlawful objects  consent to use objects as evidence the licensee shall consent to the entry of police or other duly authorized representatives of the city at all times the licensed premises is open for business and at other reasonable times for the purpose of inspection or search the licensee shall consent to the removal from the licensed premises of all objects or items there in violation of city ordinance or state law and to the introduction of such objects or items in evidence in any prosecution that may be brought for such offense   part 1982  part 1987 health and safety code compliance  class b license  restaurant sanitation rules a no alcohol beverage license shall be issued unless the licensed premises complies with all ordinances and regulations adopted by the city including but not limited to health building fire and sign codes b no class b or class c license shall be issued unless the licensed premises complies with rules promulgated by the department of health and social services governing sanitation in restaurants   part 1982  part 1987 licensed premises  conducted in orderly manner  gambling not permitted a each licensed premises shall at all times be conducted in an orderly manner and no disorderly riotous or indecent conduct shall be allowed at any time on a licensed premises b no gambling or game of chance of any sort shall be permitted in any form on any licensed premises this restriction shall not prohibit the possession or operation of amusement devices nor the operation of bingo if licensed by the state   part 1982  part 1983  part 1987 presence on licensed premises prohibited during closing hours a no person may permit anyone except the license holder agent or employees on duty to remain on the premises of any class a or class b licensed establishment during the closing hours required by ordinance b no person except the license holder agent or employees on duty may remain on the premises of any class a or class b licensed establishment during the closing hours required by ordinance    1983  part 1987 music in outside premises  council approval required a if the licensed premises of any retail class b licensee includes any area outside an enclosed building the licensee may apply to the city council for permission to provide live or recorded music in the outside area the city council may grant such permission after considering the size of the outside area the type of music to be provided the days and hours when the music will be provided the neighborhood around the premises and after determining that permitting music in the outside area would not adversely affect the neighborhood local residents or the general welfare of the citizens of the city b outside music shall not be permitted except during those days of the week and hours of the day specifically granted by the city council in granting the application for outside music or upon the request of any two councilmembers or the city manager the city council may amend the days or hours the outside music is permitted or may revoke the approval for outside music   part 1982  part 1987 outdoor seating the alcohol license advisory committee alac shall conduct a review of each class b license application or amendment concerning outdoor alcohol use other than special event licenses and shall forward its findings and recommendations thereon to the city council for its consideration if an establishment includes outdoor seating and is located adjacent or opposite a residential use the alac shall as a part of its review of the license application conduct a public hearing said public hearing shall require the prior notification of property owners within 400 feet of the premises and shall be conducted prior to finalization of the findings of the alac the public hearing shall permit each affected property owner or resident to address the alac in regards to the applicants request  extension of premises  temporary outdoor parties a notwithstanding anything in a right denials may be appealed to the city council b no person may use or permit the use of any area for the possession storage sale or consumption of fermented malt beverages andor intoxicating liquors without being granted and holding the appropriate alcohol beverage license and extension c the licensee desiring a temporary extension of their alcohol licensed premises shall apply on forms prepared and furnished by the city clerktreasurers office the form must be filed and the application fee paid by the applicant by the 15th of the month prior to the alac meeting the applicant shall answer each question on the form fully and truthfully d the application fee must be paid to the city clerktreasurers office prior to the alac taking any action on the application the fee is nonrefundable for any reason even if the extension of premises is not granted the fee includes the cost of publication notification of neighbors clerks office processing jpd review other staff review require the applicant to provide additional information and to furnish additional documentation as they each may request or require the alac may impose such similar andor different conditions restrictions and requirements as each governmental body decides in their own discretion including but not limited to notice to neighbors private security no beer or alcohol outdoors no outside live music or other sound amplification hours of operation designation of the extended premises andor such other and additional restrictions conditions and or requirements as each separately may discretionarily deem appropriate and in the best interest of the city and its residents h the alacs decision may be appealed to the city council whose decision is binding and final i the following conditions and restrictions shall apply to the grant issuance and use of an alcohol beverage temporary extension of premises permit 1 no premises may be granted or issued more than two separate occasion extension permits per year 2 each extension of premises permit shall be allowed during a single calendar day only and no twoday or multipleday permits functions or events shall be licensed or permitted hereunder 3 each extension of premises permit shall allow the possession sale and consumption of fermented malt beverages and intoxicating liquors within the hours set by the city council but in no event longer than the hours otherwise allowed by law 4 the outdoor use and occasion shall be confined to the temporarily extended premises and originally licensed premises and shall be contiguous with the licensed premises and solely upon such privately owned premises an extension permit shall not include any public streets walks or other public property unless permitted to do so in strict compliance with the conditions of the extension permit and the requirements of this chapter 5 there shall be no amplified music or other amplified sound outside upon the extended licensed premises without express permission from the alcohol license advisory committee there shall be no other disturbing noise or disorderly conduct all outside music shall cease no later than  pm on the day of the event 6 outdoor activities must stop not later than  pm and all clean up must be completed not later than  pm on the day of the event  drinking in public prohibited a no person shall drink or carry for the purpose of immediate consumption any alcohol beverage upon the streets sidewalks parks public parking lots public school property or other public property or upon any private parking lot or any other private areas that are open to public use b any person carrying any open cup can glass bottle or similar drinking vessel containing alcohol beverages upon the streets sidewalks parks public parking lots public school property or other public property or upon any private parking lot or any other private areas that are open to public use shall be in violation of this section c the city council may grant exceptions to this section for municipal property regularly established athletic fields and stadiums school buildings or churches and sidewalk cafes operated in accordance with that are lawfully included in the licensed premises description d also exempt from the prohibitions of this and related ordinances are those abutting streets and sidewalks in b5 and b6 zoning districts closed under of street closure  or of financial gain on public property  for civic community or neighborhood events or events licensed under wis stats  1255110b wine walks 1 in order to be exempt from the prohibitions of this and related ordinances the sponsor of the event must apply by the 15th of the month prior to the event that the consumption of alcohol beverages be permitted during the event the application for public consumption of alcohol must be accompanied by a nonrefundable fee the fee shall be in an amount as established by the city council from time to time and set forth in the fee schedule that appears in this 2 no glass bottles or glass containers are permitted on any public street sidewalk park public parking lot or other public property or private parking lot exempt under d of this section 3 during an authorized event individuals may purchase fermented malt beverages coolers wines and intoxicating liquors from class b licensed establishments and carry and consume such alcohol beverages upon the closed public streets sidewalks and terraces in compliance with d2 of this section 4 event sponsors must provide wristbands that must be worn by all individuals that will possess or consume alcohol during the event all alcohol beverages must be in a clear plastic cup 5 no individual may bring fermented malt beverages or intoxicating liquors onto the grounds of a special event covered by d of this section that were not purchased from a class b licensed establishment 6 all applications to allow the public consumption of alcohol under d of this section must be reviewed and approved by the alcohol license advisory committee if the alcohol license advisory committee does not approve an event for exemption the applicant may appeal to the city council by filing a written appeal with the city clerktreasurer within 30 days all decisions by the city council are final e also exempt from the prohibitions of this and related ordinances are for permits granted by the recreation director andor his or her designee in accordance with allowing the possession and consumption of fermented malt beverages and wines in the designated areas of traxler park riverside park palmer park the town square and festival street river street from milwaukee street to court street and all abutting public property when festival street is rented for a private event   i 11132017   i 2112019  abandonment of premises any licensee holding a license to sell alcohol beverages who abandons such business shall forfeit any right or preference he or she may have to the holding of or renewal of such license abandonment shall be sufficient grounds for revocation of an alcohol beverage license the closing of the licensed premises for at least 90 days shall be prima facie evidence of an abandonment notwithstanding the provisions of this chapter any newly licensed premise is not required to open initially for a period of 240 days   part 1982  part 1987  ii 10142019 license revocation  relicensing whenever any license is revoked at least 60 days from the time of such revocation shall elapse before another license may be granted for the same premises and 12 months shall elapse before any other license may be granted to the person whose license was revoked   part 1982  part 1987 substantial change in beneficial ownership  new alcohol license required a a new alcohol license is required for each substantial change in the beneficial ownership of any alcohol licensed business or interest for purposes of this section the term beneficial ownership includes but is not limited to any and all direct and indirect legal equitable and financial rights titles interests of whatsoever kind and nature b for a corporation the term substantial change includes but is not limited to each and every action of whatsoever kind and nature affecting singularly or in aggregate 20 percent or more of the issued shares or stock c for a partnership the term substantial change includes but is not limited to each and every action of whatsoever kind and nature affecting the number of general partners or which singularly or in aggregate affect 20 percent or more of the individual andor aggregate general andor limited partner beneficial ownership interest d for a sole proprietor the term substantial change includes but is not limited to each and every change in the beneficial ownership of the business    1987 public facility  fermented malt beverages and intoxicating beverages prohibited the drinking or possession of fermented malt beverages or intoxicating liquor is prohibited within the limits of any public parks facility or other public property included in this chapter except as specifically permitted by other city ordinance  possession sale and consumption of fermented malt beverages and intoxicating liquors permitted at specific public parks city facilities and other public property a for purposes of this section the following terms shall be defined as follows beer fermented malt beverages and fermented malt beverage based wine coolers mean those beverages as defined in wis stats ch 125 as from time to time amended andor as defined andor interpreted by the wisconsin department of revenue as from time to time modified city means the city of janesville and its lawfully authorized officials officers employees agents and representatives lessee means the person managing leasing andor operating the city of janesville owned public golf course under a written lease agreement with the city of janesville and the lessees consumption of fermented malt beverages and intoxicating liquors is permitted at the following public parks city facilities or other public property but only in strict accord with the provisions of this chapter 1 riverside golf course 2 blackhawk golf course 3 rotary gardens 4 dawson park and field 5 the tallman house hellen jeffris wood museum and visitor center c only the lessee of such property may apply for a class b license and then only if the lease permits such activity d only fermented malt beverages and intoxicating liquors purchased from the city or the citys licensee may be sold possessed and consumed on the property no fermented malt beverages or intoxicating liquors of any kind may be brought transported possessed consumed or sold by any person other than the city or the citys lessee e all fermented malt beverages and intoxicating liquors shall be sold possessed and consumed only in nonglass disposable containers f only those persons of lawful drinking age may possess and consume alcohol under this chapter and underage persons but only if such underage persons parent or guardian accompanies the underage person and permits the possession or consumption of the permitted alcohol as those terms are understood in wisconsin alcohol laws no underage person shall possess or consume any permitted alcohol with the parent or guardian present at the time of such underage persons consumption or without the express permission of such parent or guardian g the city council of the city hereby expressly and forever reserve unto themselves all rights privileges and prerogatives to amend condition modify and otherwise limit at any time any alcohol beverage license or permit granted or issued by the city to the lessee but only after public hearing and public action thereon in open session the public peace health safety welfare and good so requiring  possession sale and consumption of fermented malt beverages and wine permitted at specific public parks the city the public peace health safety welfare and good so requiring  secs 629652  reserved article ii  fermented malt beverages sale of fermented malt beverages in class a stores  am pm a the sale of fermented malt beverages upon the premises of a class a liquor store fermented malt beverage alcohol licensed premises shall cease daily at  pm and shall not resume until  am the following morning no fermented malt beverages may be sold between the hours of  pm and  am upon any class a fermented malt beverage alcohol licensed premises this restriction by ordinance is authorized by wis stats  125323b and d as from time to time amended or renumbered and is hereby enacted in conformity therewith b by enacting this chapter the city council for the city of janesville hereby find that this chapter and the enactment of more restrictive fermented malt beverage sales hours is for the betterment of the community  directly facilitates the health welfare peace safety and tranquility of the community  directly and indirectly will reduce the probability andor problem of the purchase of fermented malt beverages by underage persons within the community  and will directly and indirectly reduce the consumption of fermented malt beverages by underage persons within the community  sale of intoxicating liquor in class a stores  am pm the sale of intoxicating liquor upon the premises of a class a liquor store intoxicating liquor alcohol beverage licensed premises shall cease daily at  pm and shall not resume until  am the following morning no intoxicating liquor may be sold between the hours of  pm and  am upon any class a intoxicating liquor alcohol beverage licensed premises  licenses  when required  application of this chapter no person may sell manufacture rectify brew or engage in any other activity for which this chapter provides a license without holding the appropriate license issued under this chapter  license term  expiration a licenses to sell fermented malt beverages shall be issued for a period not to exceed one year such licenses shall expire on june 30 of each year b licenses may be issued after july 1 in any licensing year such licenses shall expire on the following june 30 the fee for such licenses shall not be prorated c sixmonth class b licenses may be issued at any time over a period of six months in any calendar year for which 75 percent of the license fee shall be paid such licenses are not renewable during the calendar year in which issued  class a licenses  issuance based on population  exceptions  exceeding quota  location restrictions a the city may issue class a licenses for the sale of fermented malt beverages for premises within the municipality a class a license authorizes retail sales of fermented malt beverages for consumption off the premises where sold and in original packages and containers b not more than one class a fermented malt beverage license may be issued for each 3500 or fraction thereof of the population of the city according to the most recent official annual population estimate of the wisconsin department of administration except as otherwise provided in this chapter c licenses issued to hotels having more than 30 rooms which are equipped and in use for rental to guests as sleeping quarters shall not be counted in the number permitted under the limitation in this section d notwithstanding the provisions of this chapter the city council may by at least a majority vote of all the members of the city council grant a new retail class a fermented malt beverage license in excess of the quota set forth in b of this section such license is not intended to perpetually increase the quota but rather to exceed the quota when issuance of a license would promote redevelopment of an underutilized commercial property or establishment of a new business within the community until such time as a class a license is available as set forth in b of this section the quota may be exceeded if the establishment meets all other provisions as set forth in this chapter and the following criteria shall be met 1 the applicant shall submit to the city clerk a petition for exceeding quota the petition shall include a business plan of operation and the relevant experience background and signatures of the individual partners or directors officers and agent of a corporation of limited liability company as well as the signature of the owner or owners of the building or land and any and all other information required in   2 the applicant shall supply proof of ownership lease or an option to purchase or lease land or a building that is properly zoned for the proposed venture  3 the alcohol license advisory committee shall review the application the reports of impacted departments and all other information before it and make a recommendation to the city council e a class a fermented malt beverage license may be issued only to a person who is also applying for a retail class a license to sell intoxicating liquor  class b licenses  issuance based on population  exceptions  effect of annexation on renewal the city may issue class b licenses for the sake of fermented malt beverages from premises within the municipality 1 class b license authorizes retail sales of fermented malt beverages to be consumed either on the premises where sold or off the premises 2 not more than one class b fermented malt beverage license may be issued for every 900 or fraction thereof of the population of the city according to the official population estimate of the wisconsin department of administration which is the basis for determining per capita state shared taxes for the november distribution except as provided in this chapter 3 the following class b fermented malt beverage licenses shall not be included in the number limitation set forth above a class b licenses for restaurants  b class b beer only licenses  c class b licenses issued to clubs and lodges  d class b licenses issued to hotels having more than 30 rooms which are equipped and in use for rental to guests as sleeping quarters  e class b temporary special event licenses 4 the annexation of territory containing class b fermented malt beverage licensed premises shall increase the quota of class b fermented malt beverage licenses if necessary to allow the relicensing of all existing class b fermented malt beverage licensed premises in the municipality after such annexation all licensees holding existing class b fermented malt beverage licenses shall not lose such licenses except for cause and the licenses may be renewed irrespective of the number limitation if the licensees are otherwise satisfactory  class b licenses for restaurants  issuance based on population  requirements a the city may issue class b fermented malt beverage licenses for restaurants in addition to any other class b fermented malt beverage licenses granted pursuant to this chapter there shall not be more than one class b fermented malt beverage license for restaurants issued for every 3300 or fraction thereof of the population of the city according to the last decennial federal census b all other provisions of this chapter shall apply to the licenses created by this section unless in direct conflict therewith in which case the express provisions of this section shall prevail c additional requirements for the class b fermented malt beverage license for restaurants shall be as follows 1 such license shall be issued only to establishments which are bona fide restaurants the following criteria shall be used in determining whether or not an establishment is a bona fide restaurant a the principal business of the establishment must be to cater to and serve fullcourse meals to the general public b the business shall be advertised and held out to the public as a place where meals are prepared and served space being provided with adequate kitchen and dining room equipment and persons being employed to prepare cook and serve meals for guests c tables shall be of adequate size to accommodate the service of full course meals in accordance with the number of chairs at each table 2 the licensed establishment must derive at least 65 percent of its gross revenue from the sale of food and nonalcoholic beverages the 65 percent shall be determined by taking the average monthly gross revenue of the sale of food and nonalcoholic beverages over the period of a calendar year 3 a after the first 90 days of operation following initial issuance of the license the licensee shall file with the city clerk an affidavit prepared by a certified public accountant such affidavit shall state the percent of gross revenue from the sale of food and nonalcohol beverages and the percent of gross revenue from the sale of fermented malt beverages and intoxicating liquor for such initial 90day period b after the second 90 days of operation following initial issuance of the license the licensee shall file with the city clerk his or her notarized statement showing the percent of gross revenue from the sale of food and nonalcoholic beverages and the percent of gross revenue from the sale of fermented malt beverages and intoxicating liquor for such second 90day period c thereafter such notarized statement of the licensee shall be filed with the renewal application and shall include sales for the entire previous calendar year d the liquor license advisory committee may at any time it is deemed necessary request the licensee to file an affidavit of a certified public accountant to verify the percent of gross revenue as shown on the licensees notarized statement 4 the licensee by application for and receipt of this license agrees to an examination of his or her business records for the purpose of verification of the percent of food sales by the city manager or his or her delegated representative at all reasonable times d failure to file the required affidavit failure to maintain the required percent of food sales or failure to comply with any of the requirements for the class b fermented malt beverage license for restaurants shall be grounds for nonrenewal suspension or revocation of the class b fermented malt beverage license for restaurants  class b beer only licenses  issuance based on population  requirements a the city may issue class b beer only licenses in addition to any other license granted pursuant to this chapter there shall not be more than one class b beer only license issued for every 3300 or fraction thereof of the population of the city according to the last decennial federal census b all other provisions of this chapter shall apply to the licenses created by this section unless in direct conflict therewith in which case the express provisions of this section shall prevail c additional requirements for the class b beer only license shall be as follows 1 such license shall be issued only to restaurants where at least 50 percent of the gross revenue is from the sale of food 2 licensees may sell or offer for sale in cans bottles andor by draft and for consumption upon the licensed premises only beer beer coolers and such other fermented malt beverages as are specifically permitted by the wisconsin statutes as from time to time amended 3 the licensee by application for and receipt of this license agrees to an examination of his or her business records for the purpose of verification of the percent of food sales by the city manager or his or her delegated representative at all reasonable times d failure to maintain the required percent of food sales or failure to comply with any of the requirements for the class b beer only license shall be grounds for nonrenewal suspension or revocation of the class b beer only license e exempt from the provisions of subsections c and d of this section are beer only licenses issued for premises which are operated as part of and in conjunction with municipally owned golf courses such licenses issued to premises which are operated as part of and in conjunction with municipally owned golf courses are not transferable to any other premises  class b license for clubs and lodges the city may issue class b fermented malt beverage licenses to clubs and lodges situated and incorporated or chartered in the state for at least six years such licenses shall be in addition to any other licenses granted pursuant to this chapter such license shall entitle the club or lodge to serve fermented malt beverages to club members invited guests and the general public  class b temporary special event licenseapplication a any bona fide nonprofit club state county or local fair association veterans post lodge or society that has been in existence for at least six months before the date of application may apply for a class b temporary special event fermented malt beverage license for a picnic fair group gathering public event or other similar gathering b such application shall be filed on forms provided by the state of wisconsin department of revenue and shall include a description of the exact location of the event and a map showing such location c the fee for such special event license shall be in an amount as established by the city council from time to time and set forth in the fee schedule that appears in this d special event licenses are exempt from the food license requirements pursuant to of e any special event license granted pursuant to this chapter shall not be counted in the number permitted under any other section of this f every applicant who is granted a class b temporary special event fermented malt beverage license shall comply in all respects with all ordinances and statutes that apply to class b fermented malt beverage licenses unless such ordinances or statutes specifically exempt the special event licensee  class b temporary special event licenseissuance regulations in these ordinances to the contrary are waived for such events when licensed  class b temporary special event licensereview grant and issue by alcohol license advisory committee and chief of police a pursuant to applicable wisconsin statutes as from time to time amended the city council hereby authorizes and empowers the alcohol license advisory committee or the chief of police to independently and separately review the applications grant issue deny restrict modify condition revoke suspend and enforce temporary special event class b alcohol licenses without the necessity for review or action by the city council b the city council notwithstanding anything in this section to the contrary reserves unto itself any and all rights and powers vested by state law and otherwise including issue deny restrict modify condition revoke suspend and modify repeal andor overrule decisions of the alcohol license advisory committee or chief of police pertaining thereto c the specific procedure for such review and grant by the alcohol license advisory committee or chief of police shall be established from time to time by practice or policy d notice of all actions by the alcohol license advisory committee or the chief of police under this section shall be provided to the city council  class b temporary special event licensewristbands  posting required a a wristband that is tamperresistant and nontransferable shall be applied by the licensee after ascertaining that a purchaser andor anyone receiving alcoholic beverages are of legal age for all temporary special events occurring on public property partially or entirely outdoors the licensee shall make an even greater effort to prevent the sale possession and consumption of alcohol by underage persons outdoors than he or she would indoors b if the temporary special event is occurring partially or entirely outdoors the licensee shall post at least two signs with large letters in conspicuous places within the confines of the licensed premises directing all patrons to consume the fermented malt beverages only within the licensed premises or outdoor permitted area and warning all patrons that to consume the fermented malt beverages outside such area is a violation of city ordinance the alcohol licensed activities can only take place in the area specifically set forth in the special event application or license  class b temporary special event licensed premises to be left in good condition if the licensed premises are located on public property such premises shall be cleaned of all litter at the conclusion of the licensed event any damage occurring during the period shall be repaired at the expense of the licensee the premises shall be placed in the same or better physical condition after the licensed event than such premises were in prior to the event  sale in public parks  license not required  receipt to public treasury  restrictions officers and employees of the city are authorized to sell fermented malt beverages in the public parks or the city properties listed in city ordinances without the necessity of obtaining a license therefore provided that all receipts from such sale shall go into the public treasury requirements pertaining to licenses imposed by this chapter shall not apply to such sales but all other applicable restrictions upon sale of fermented malt beverages imposed by this chapter shall apply except  sale of fermented malt beverages wines and wine coolers in public parks any fermented malt beverages wines and wine coolers sold pursuant to this chapter may be possessed sold and consumed only within the public parks public properties and municipal facilities specifically designated and authorized by the city council in the applicable general ordinances of the city of janesville as from time to time amended  secs 669694  reserved article iii  intoxicating liquor sales license  when required  application of this chapter no person may sell manufacture rectify brew or engage in any other activity for which this chapter provides a license without holding the appropriate license issued under this chapter  license term  expiration a licenses to sell intoxicating liquor shall be issued for a period not to exceed one year such licenses shall expire on june 30 of each year b licenses may be issued after july 1 in any licensing year such license shall expire on the following june 30 the fee for such license shall be prorated on the basis of onetwelfth or the annual fee for each month or fraction of a month remaining until the next june 30 c sixmonth class b licenses may be issued at any time in any licensing year for which onehalf of the license fee shall be paid such licenses are not renewable during the calendar year in which issued   part 1982 class a licenses  issuance based on population  exceptions  exceeding quota  location restrictions a the city may issue class a licenses for the sale of intoxicating liquor for premises within the municipality a class a license authorizes retail sales of intoxicating liquor for consumption off the premises where sold and in original packages and containers b not more than one class a intoxicating liquor license may be issued for each 3500 or fraction thereof of the population of the city according to the most recent official annual population estimate of the wisconsin department of administration except as otherwise provided in this chapter c licenses issued to hotels having more than 30 rooms which are equipped and in use for rental to guests as sleeping quarters shall not be counted in the number permitted under the limitation in this section d notwithstanding the provisions of this chapter the city council may by at least a majority vote of all the members of the city council grant a new retail class a intoxicating liquor license in excess of the quota set forth in b of this section such license is not intended to perpetually increase the quota but rather to exceed the quota when issuance of a license would expand the trade impact of an existing business or promote redevelopment of an underutilized commercial property or establishment of a new business within the community until such time as a class a license is available as set forth in b of this section the quota may be exceeded if the establishment meets all other provisions as set forth in this chapter and the following criteria shall be met 1 the applicant shall submit to the city clerk a petition for exceeding quota the petition shall include a business plan of operation and the relevant experience background and signatures of the individual partners or directors officers and agent of a corporation or limited liability company as well as the signature of the owner or owners of the building or land and any and all other information required in   2 the applicant shall supply proof of ownership lease or an option to purchase or lease land or a building that is properly zoned for the proposed venture  3 the alcohol license advisory committee shall review the application the reports of impacted departments and all other information before it and make a recommendation to the city council e a class a intoxicating liquor license may be issued only to a person who is also applying for a retail class a license to sell fermented malt beverages  class b licenses  issuance based on population exceptions  effect of annexation on renewal a the city may issue class b licenses for the sale of intoxicating liquor for premises within the municipality a class b license authorizes retail sales of intoxicating liquor for consumption on the premises where sold by the glass and not in the original package or container however wine may be sold in the original package or container in any quantity to be consumed off the premises where sold b not more than one class b intoxicating liquor license may be issued for every 900 or fraction thereof of the population of the city according to the official population estimate of the wisconsin department of administration which is the basis for determining the per capita state shared taxes for the november distribution except as provided in this chapter c the following class b intoxicating liquor licenses shall not be included in the limitation set forth above 1 class b licenses for restaurants  2 class b licenses issued to clubs and lodges  3 class b licenses issued to hotels having more than 30 rooms which are equipped and in use for rental to guests as sleeping quarters d the annexation of territory containing class b intoxicating liquor licensed premises shall increase the quota of class b intoxicating liquor licenses if necessary to allow the relicensing of all existing class b intoxicating liquor licensed premises in the municipality after such annexation all licensees holding existing class b intoxicating liquor licenses shall not lose such licenses except for cause and the licenses may be renewed irrespective of the number limitation if the licensees are otherwise satisfactory e irrespective of the limitation as to number of licenses permitted by this chapter the number issued shall never exceed the number permitted by state statute  class b licenses for restaurants  issuance based on population  requirements a the city may issue class b intoxicating liquor licenses for restaurants in addition to any other class b intoxicating liquor licenses granted pursuant to this chapter there shall not be more than one class b intoxicating liquor license for restaurants issued for every 3300 or fraction thereof of the population of the city according to the last decennial federal census b all other provisions of this chapter shall apply to the licenses created by this section unless in direct conflict therewith in which case the express provisions of this section shall prevail c additional requirements for the class b intoxicating liquor license for restaurants shall be as follows 1 such license shall be issued only to establishments which are bona fide restaurants the following criteria shall be used in determining whether or not an establishment is a bona fide restaurant a the principal business of the establishment must be to cater to and serve full course meals to the general public b the business shall be advertised and held out to the public as a place where meals are prepared and served space being provided with adequate kitchen and dining room equipment and persons being employed to prepare cook and serve meals for guests c tables shall be of adequate size to accommodate the service of full course meals in accordance with the number of chairs at each table 2 the licensed establishment must derive at least 65 percent of its gross revenue from the sale of food and nonalcoholic beverages the 65 percent shall be determined by taking the average monthly gross revenue of the sale of food and nonalcoholic beverages over the period of a calendar year 3 a after the first 90 days of operation following initial issuance of the license the licensee shall file with the city clerk an affidavit prepared by a certified public accountant such affidavit shall state the percent of gross revenue from the sale of food and nonalcohol beverages and the percent of gross revenue from the sale of fermented malt beverages and intoxicating liquor for such initial 90day period b after the second 90 days of operation following initial issuance of the license the licensee shall file with the city clerk his or her notarized statement showing the percent of gross revenue from the sale of food and nonalcoholic beverages and the percent of gross revenue from the sale of fermented malt beverages and intoxicating liquor for such second 90day period c thereafter such notarized statement of the licensee shall be filed with the renewal application and shall include sales for the entire previous calendar year d the liquor license advisory committee may at any time it is deemed necessary request the licensee to file an affidavit of a certified public accountant to verify the percent of gross revenue as shown on the licensees notarized statement 4 the licensee by application for and receipt of this license agrees to an examination of his or her business records for the purpose of verification of the percent of food sales by the city manager or his or her delegated representative at all reasonable times d failure to file the required affidavit failure to maintain the required percent of food sales or failure to comply with any of the requirements for the class b intoxicating liquor license for restaurants shall be grounds for nonrenewal suspension or revocation of the class b intoxicating liquor license for restaurants  class b licenses for clubs and lodges the city may issue class b intoxicating liquor licenses to clubs and lodges situated and incorporated or chartered in the state for at least six years such licenses shall be in addition to any other licenses granted pursuant to this chapter such license shall entitle the club or lodge to serve intoxicating liquor to club members invited guests and the general public   part 1982 class b license  fermented malt beverage license required no retail class b intoxicating liquor license may be issued to any person who does not have or to whom is not issued a class b retail license to sell fermented malt beverages   part 1982 class c licenses  wine only  fees  requirements  no quota a in this subsection the term barroom means a room that is primarily used for the sale of consumption of alcohol beverages b a class c license authorizes the retail sale of wine by the glass or in an opened original container for consumption on the premises where sold c a class c license may be issued to a person qualified under wis stats  125045 for 1 a restaurant in which the sale of alcohol beverages accounts for less than 50 percent of gross annual receipts and which does not have a barroom  or 2 a restaurant in which the sale of alcohol beverages accounts for less than 50 percent of gross annual receipts and which does have a barroom in which wine is the only intoxicating liquor sold d a class c license may not be issued to a foreign corporation a foreign limited liability company or a person acting as agent for or in the employ of another e a class c license and application shall particularly describe the premises for which it is issued f the annual fee for a class c license shall be in an amount as established by the city council from time to time and set forth in the fee schedule that appears in this fee shall be the same for all class c licenses there shall be no prorating the annual fee g there shall be no quota for the number of class c license issued in the city h 1 after the first 90 days of operation following initial issuance of the license the licensee shall file with the city clerk an affidavit prepared by a certified public accountant such affidavit shall state the percent of gross revenue from the sale of food and nonalcohol beverages and the percent of gross revenue from the sale of fermented malt beverages if any and separately for wine for such initial 90day period 2 after the second 90 days of operation following initial issuance of the license the licensee shall file with the city clerk his or her notarized statement showing the percent of gross revenue from the sale of food and nonalcoholic beverages and the percent of gross revenue from the sale of fermented malt beverages if any and separately for wine for such second 90day period 3 thereafter such notarized statement of the licensee shall be filed with the renewal application and shall include sales information for the entire previous calendar year 4 the liquor license advisory committee may at any time it is deemed necessary request the licensee to file an affidavit of a certified public accountant to verify the percent of gross revenues for such categories set forth above for any time period andor as shown on the licensees notarized statement 5 the licensee by application for and receipt of this license agrees to an examination of his or her business records for the purpose of verification of the percent of food fermented malt beverage and wine sales by the city manager or his or her delegated representative at all reasonable times 6 failure to file the required affidavit failure to maintain the required percent of food sales or failure to comply with any of the requirements for the class c wine license for restaurants shall be grounds for nonrenewal suspension or revocation of the class c wine license for restaurants i all other applicable provisions of the citys alcohol ordinances and state alcohol statutes
