create an offensive smell or nuisance in the neighborhood or elsewhere or a health hazard is prohibited the burning of rubber tires or floor mats is expressly prohibited  salvage yards and salvage automobiles  restrictions the following restrictions apply to auto salvage yards and salvaged automobiles 1 each auto salvage yard shall be fenced with a solid fence for screening purposes for protection of life limb and property at least seven feet in height in accordance with directions of the building inspector 2 no salvage automobiles shall be stored parked or kept outside of the fenced area 3 no salvage yard shall be located except in an area zoned industrial and in no event so that any portion of the yard is within 500 feet of a first or second residential district prior 286   licensed premises to comply with ordinances and official orders  cleanliness requirements  inspection all licensed premises shall be kept reasonably clean and shall comply with all lawful ordinances and orders of the city and its official no rat harborages sources of filth or causes of sickness or fire hazards shall be maintained the premises shall be open to inspection by city police health fire and licensing officers during normal business hours  license  revocation  hearing procedure  licensee notification the license provided for in this article shall be revocable at any time by the council after a hearing at which it has been found that the licensee has failed or refused to comply with the terms and conditions of this article or lawful orders issued under this article the revocation hearing shall be held by the council upon its own motion or upon the complaint in writing duly signed and verified by a complainant such complaint shall state the nature of the alleged failure to comply with this article or lawful order issued under this article a copy of the complaint together with a notice of hearing shall be served upon the licensee not less than ten days prior to the date of hearing the licensee may be represented by counsel at the hearing prior 288   violation  penalty violators of this article shall forfeit not less than $1000 nor more than $20000 for each offense or in default of payment thereof shall be imprisoned in the county jail for a period not exceeding 60 days each day of violation constitutes a separate offense prior 289   secs 1239712420  reserved article xiv  solicitors solicitation regulatedapplicability 1 all solicitation within the city is regulated by this article 2 each and every person who directly or indirectly engages in solicitation within the city is regulated by this article 3 each and every person exempt from registration under this article shall comply with each and every nonregistration provision and requirement of this article  solicitation regulatedprohibition no person shall directly or indirectly engage in any solicitation contrary to this article  definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning applicant means a person who files a registration form with the liquor license advisory committee for the purpose of obtaining a solicitor permit chief of police and police chief mean the city chief of police andor his or her representative city means the city of janesville a wisconsin municipal corporation located in the county of rock clerk means the city clerk andor his or her representative hold and holding mean an applicants physical possession of an approved valid and issued solicitor permit issue means the physical delivery of a solicitor permit by the city clerk to the applicant nonprofit means holding the current written determination by the internal revenue service that a person is exempt from federal income taxation person means each and every individual firm corporation partnership organization cooperative venture and combination of persons of whatsoever kind or nature registered means having been issued a solicitor permit by the city clerk registration means the application for a solicitor permit in the manner set forth below solicitation means each and every transaction activity or conduct occurring wholly or in part within the city engaged in by any person who directly or indirectly 1 sells  2 offers or attempts to sell  3 takes or attempts to take one or more sales andor purchase orders for the later delivery of goods or services  or 4 in any manner requests asks solicits or demands or attempts to request ask solicit or demand anything of value  at any location other than the permanent business place or residence of said person solicitor means a person who directly or indirectly engages in any solicitation in the city solicitor permit means the city document requested by an applicant reviewed by the chief of police and if approved issued by the clerk according to the procedures set forth in this article permitting a nonexempt person to engage in solicitation valid solicitor permit means an issued solicitor permit which is not expired revoked or suspended  prohibited practices no person engaged in solicitation shall 1 call at any dwelling or other place between the hours of  pm and  am except by appointment 2 call at any residential dwelling or other place where a sign is displayed bearing the words no peddlers no solicitors or words of similar meaning or nature 3 call at the rear door of any dwelling place at any time 4 remain on any portion of any premises after being asked to leave by the owner occupant or other person having authority over such premises 5 fail to obey any lawful order of the chief of police or any law enforcement officer 6 litter accumulate or allow the littering or the accumulation of any litter refuse or rubbish in or around the area in which such solicitor is conducting business 7 disturb the peace make noise or use any soundamplifying device to attract people if the noise produced is capable of being plainly heard outside a 50foot radius of the source 8 block vehicular or pedestrian traffic 9 damage property 10 directly or indirectly misrepresent or make false deceptive misleading or incomplete statements concerning the quality quantity or character of any good offered for sale the purpose of the visit the solicitors activity the solicitors identity or the identity or purpose of the organization represented 11 violate any other ordinance or law 12 in the event that the person is acting on behalf of a charitable benevolent educational or nonprofit organization or corporation refuse to specifically and accurately disclose as a percentage of the sale or donation price of the goods or services the portion of the sale or donation price of the goods or services offered which shall actually be used for the charitable benevolent educational or nonprofit purpose for which the solicitation is being made  required practicesdisclosure each and every person whether or not exempt from registration under this article shall after the initial greeting and before any other solicitationoriented statement is made to a prospective customer donee or solicitee expressly disclose such solicitors name the name of the affiliated organization or business if any and a complete and truthful identification of the goods services and purpose for the solicitation  required practicesright to cancellation  notice each and every person whether or not exempt from registration under this article shall 1 in the event that such personsolicitor sells or attempts to sell any goods or services for immediate or future delivery immediately notify the buyer verbally and in writing that the buyer has and shall have the right to cancel any part or the entire sale andor other transaction and recover the entire consideration paid if any no later than midnight of the third night after closing the transaction and otherwise in compliance with all federal and state laws rules regulations and directives 2 in the event that such personsolicitor takes a sales andor other order for the later delivery of goods or services at the time the order is taken provide the buyer with a written statement signed by the solicitor containing the terms of the agreement  the amount paid in advance whether full partial or no advance payment is made  the name address and telephone number of the solicitor  the delivery or performance date  and whether a guarantee or warranty is provided and if so the terms thereof  registrationrequired each and every person prior to engaging in any solicitation or other activities regulated by this article shall file for registration with the city clerk pay the permit fee seek to obtain and if and when issued hold a valid solicitor permit  registrationexemptions the following persons shall be exempt from the registration provisions of this article 1 any person exclusively delivering newspapers fuel dairy products or bakery good to regular customers on established routes 2 any person selling goods at wholesale to dealers in such goods 3 any person selling agricultural products which such person or member of his or her immediate family has grown 4 any person who has an established place of business where the goods being sold are offered for sale on a regular basis and in which the buyer has initiated contact with and specifically requested a home visit by said person 5 any person who has had and any person who represents a person who has had a prior business transaction such as a prior sale or credit arrangement with prospective customer 6 any person conducting a sale required by law or by order of any court 7 any person conducting a bona fide auction sale pursuant to law 8 any person conducting or engaging in any activity as a member of any benevolent charitable educational or nonprofit organization or corporation except those persons who are not members of the organization and who have been independently contracted by and receive compensation for their solicitation activities from the herein described organizations 9 any person engaging in solicitation upon property zoned commercial business or industrial buy only if the solicitor has received prior express permission from the owner or legal possessor of such property  and the solicitor fully complies with the applicable city outdoor storage and display of merchandise ordinance 10 any and all minors but only if an adult responsible for the activities and representations of such minor applies for registration and in the manner required by this article is investigated approved is issued and holds a valid license and each minor shall at all times while soliciting carry and show upon demand a photocopy of the responsible adults permit  registrationprocedure each and every person not exempt from registration in addition to complying with each and every other provision of this article shall 1 as required by this article complete and file with the clerk the registration form pay the registration fee obtain approval from the chief of police and have issued and hold a valid solicitor permit prior to engaging in any solicitation transaction conduct or other activity regulated by this article 2 neither directly nor indirectly engage in any solicitation transaction conduct or activity regulated by this article without holding a valid solicitor permit  registrationform  contents  fee a the registration form furnished by the clerk shall require the following information which the applicant shall provide fully accurately and in writing 1 applicants name permanent address telephone number and localtemporary address if any 2 applicants age height weight color of hair and eyes 3 name permanent address telephone number of the business partnership firm association or corporation the applicant represents is employed by or whose merchandise is being sold 4 localtemporary address and telephone number from which the applicants activities will be conducted 5 nature of the business andor activities to be conducted and a brief description of the goods andor services offered 6 proposed method of delivery of goods if applicable 7 make model and license number of any vehicle to be used by applicant in the conduct of such applicants activities 8 last three cities villages or towns where applicant conducted similar activities 9 locations where applicant can be contacted for at least 14 days after leaving the city 10 a statement as to whether the applicant has been convicted of any crime or ordinance violation related to applicants transient merchant business or solicitation activities within the last five years the nature of the offense and the place of conviction 11 a statement appointing the clerk such persons agent to accept service or process in any civil action brought against the applicant arising out of any sale service or activity performed by the applicant in connection with the activities of the applicant governed by this article in the event the applicant cannot after reasonable effort be served personally 12 attached to the registration form shall be two recent photographs of the applicant which pictures shall be not less than two inches by two inches and showing the face and shoulders of the applicant in a clear and distinguishing manner b at the time of filing the registration form with the clerk each applicant shall present to the clerk for examination 1 a drivers license or some other adequate proof in identity as may be required by the clerk 2 a state certificate of examination and approval from the sealer of weights and measures when the applicants business requires use of weighing and measuring devices approved by state authorities 3 a state health officers certificate when the applicants business involves the handling of food or clothing and is required to be certified under state law which certificate states that the applicant is apparently free from any contagious or infectious disease and dated not more than 90 days prior to the date the registration form is filed c at the time the registration is filed the applicant shall pay to the city clerk a nonrefundable fee the nonrefundable fee shall be in an amount as established by the city council from time to time and as set forth in the fee schedule that appears in this  issuance of permit  investigation a upon receipt of a completed registration form and fee the clerk shall indicate upon the face of the form whether the fee has been paid and then refer it to the chief of police who may make and complete an investigation of the statements made upon the registration form the applicant or both b the chief of police shall either approve or disapprove the registration application upon the face of the registration form and return it to the clerk c in the event that the chief of police approves such registration application the clerk shall issue a solicitor permit to the applicant d in the event that the chief of police disapproves such registration the clerk shall not issue a solicitor permit to the applicant e the chief of police may disapprove any registration in the event he or she finds any one or a combination of the following 1 the registration form contains any material omission or any inaccurate false or misleading statement 2 the applicant violated any provision of any similar or related state federal or local ordinance or law anywhere in the previous five years 3 that there is reason to believe that the applicant violated any provision of any similar or related state federal or local ordinance or law anywhere in the previous five years 4 the applicant failed andor fails to comply with any provision of this article 5 the chief of police finds that the applicants proposed activity andor issuance to the applicant of a city solicitor permit might not be consistent with or might be contrary to or might not be in the best interest of or otherwise not in the furtherance of the health safety or welfare of the community  appeal a any person whose registration application is disapproved by the chief of police may appeal such decision to the city council for consideration at one of its regularly scheduled meetings but only upon filing with the city clerk a written appeal within five days of receiving notice of denial and permit nonissuance b no fee shall be required for such an appeal c the written appeal shall state with particularity both the reasons why the applicant contends that the disapproval is not justified and the reasons why a solicitor permit should be issued to the applicant d upon hearing and considering the reasons proffered at such public hearing by the applicant in favor of issuance and the chief of polices reasons against the issuance of a solicitor permit to the applicant together with whatever evidence may be offered thereto by any person the city council upon not less than four affirmative votes may authorize the issuance of a solicitor permit to the applicant for such period of time as the council deems appropriate under the instant particular facts and circumstances  required practices  records  registered solicitors each and every person required by this article to register shall 1 at all times keep proper and adequate records of every contact and transaction occurring within the city 2 forthwith present any and all city solicitation and related records and documents for inspection andor photocopying whenever required or requested by the city clerk the chief of police or any person acting on behalf or either 3 maintain and preserve such records for not less than seven years from the date of the contract or transaction  revocation and suspension  solicitor permit a any solicitor permit issued under this article may be suspended or revoked at any time by the city clerk the chief of police or the city council upon 1 violation of any provision of this article by the solicitor or any of the solicitors agent representative or employee  2 the city clerks chief of polices or city councils determination that the applicants continued solicitation is not consistent with or is in any manner detrimental to or contrary to the health safety or welfare of the community  or 3 as otherwise provided by law b a registered solicitor may appeal the city clerks or chief of polices suspension or revocation of his or her solicitor permit to the city council in the manner set forth in this article for appeals of permit nonissuance it shall take four affirmative votes of the city council to overturn such administrative suspension or revocation  adoption of federal and state laws  violations a to the degree consistent with law every federal and state law rule regulation and directive as from time to time amended governing solicitors as that term is understood by this article is hereby adopted by reference and incorporated herein as if fully set forth b each and every act required to be performed or prohibited by such adopted federal or state laws rules regulations and directives is required or prohibited by this article c in the event that this provision is in conflict with any other law rule regulation or directive this article shall govern to the extent permitted by law  penalty any person violating any of the provisions of this article shall upon conviction thereof be punished by forfeiture of not less than $5000 and not more than $100000 for each offense each days continuance shall constitute a separate violation in default of payment of the forfeiture the violator shall be imprisoned for not less than ten days nor more than 90 days in the county jail  severance clause the provisions of this article are declared to be severable and if any section sentence clause or phrase of this article shall for any reason be held to be invalid or unconstitutional such decision shall not affect the validity of the remaining sections sentences clauses and phrases of this article which shall remain in effect it being the city councils legislative intent that this article shall stand notwithstanding the invalidity of any part  secs 1243812457  reserved article xv  bowling centers licenserequired no person shall erect or keep or permit to be erected placed or kept upon his or her premises within the limits of the city any bowling center used or kept for hire without first having obtained a license therefor as provided in this article  licenseapplication  form  information required  council action a every application for the license required by shall be made in writing upon blanks furnished by the city for such purpose and every such applicant must state their full name and address in the event that two or more persons are associated together the full names of all persons financially interested and their addresses must be given if the applicant is a club society or corporation the application shall contain a complete list of the officers the applicant on the application shall also provide the following information 1 the premises where said bowling center is to be maintained  2 the age home residence address and current home and business telephone numbers of the applicant  3 whether the applicant has previously been engaged in operating a bowling center and if so where when and for what length of time in each place and related information about its operation and history  4 the name of the owner of the premises on which such centers are to be located b a separate application for each premises shall be filed with the city clerk who shall forward said application to the council for action thereon  police investigation  report before any license pursuant to is issued an investigation of the premises and of the character of the applicant shall be made by the police department and a written report thereon filed with the city clerk and made a part of the application  licenseapplication and police report  council action every application for a license pursuant to together with the police departments report accompanying it shall be presented to the council at the next meeting following the filing thereof no license shall be issued until the council passes favorably on the application  licensefee  issuance the applicant for a license pursuant to shall pay the prescribed license fee to the city treasurer on filing the application the license shall be issued by the city clerk after it has been approved by the council if the license is not granted the fee deposited shall not be refunded the license fee shall be in an amount as established by the city council from time to time and as set forth in the fee schedule that appears in this  licensetransferable when no license issued under this article shall be transferable without the prior consent of the council  licenseposting requirements every licensee shall keep his or her license posted in a conspicuous place in the room in which license centers are kept  gambling prohibited no dice shall be thrown for money merchandise or credit nor shall cards raffles or other games of chance or gambling or betting in any form be permitted in any room or place where any licensed center is located nor shall there be any open or secret connection with any other room or place where persons congregate for gambling or engage in any manner in gambling or immoral purposes  sanitary lighting and ventilation requirements all rooms or places where licensed centers are maintained shall be kept at all times in a clean healthful and sanitary condition and shall be well ventilated and lighted and shall comply with all lawful rules or orders of the health department or other health authorities of the city  view obstruction not permitted no blinds screens curtains partitions or other obstructions shall be permitted to shield from view any such room or place where licensed centers are maintained and a clear view of the interior of any such room or place from the front entrance to the rear thereof must be maintained at all times  license  revocation  hearing any license issued under this article may be forfeited or revoked by a majority vote of the council for any disorderly or immoral conduct permitted on the premises covered by the license or for the violation of any rules regulations ordinances or laws governing or applying to any such licensed centers or the premises where the same are maintained  provided however that before any such license is revoked the licensee by given an opportunity to be heard in case of the revocation of any such license no portion of the license fee shall be returned  violation  penalty any person firm or corporation violating any of the provisions of this article may upon conviction therefor in court have his or her license suspended or revoked by the court andor suspended revoked or not renewed by the city council and shall further be punished by the imposition and payment of a forfeiture in an amount of not less than $5000 nor more than $100000 together with the costs of prosecution and in default of the payment of such imposed forfeiture shall be imprisoned until such forfeiture and costs are paid not to exceed 90 days each days continuance of a violation constitutes a separate offense this penalty shall be independent and exclusive of the right of the council to suspend revoke andor nonrenew any license or permit  secs 1247012491  reserved article xvi  service stations purpose the purpose of this article is to establish minimum standards and requirements governing location operation maintenance and regulation of gasoline service stations within the city  definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning aesthetic treatment means an area set aside for the planting of grass shrubs trees flowers or other natural treatment  however the plan commission may count as much as five percent towards the aesthetic treatment requirement if the proposed building has unusual natural aesthetic appeal bay means an area within the building intended for or usable as a location to service repair or wash a car each area large enough to accommodate one car shall be considered as one bay emergency services means a service rendered to a customer that is unusual due to some type of urgent situation this service due to unusual circumstances requires services performed outside the building but in no case takes more than 24 hours to complete gasoline dispensing station means a station dispensing gasoline and related automotive products gasoline service station means a station dispensing gasoline and related automotive products and in addition provides auto servicing and repairs in a service bay jats plan means an approved plan of the janesville area transportation study showing future widening of some arterial streets lot width means the horizontal distance between the side lot line of a lot measured at right angles to the lot depth said measurement to be made at the rear line of the required front yard    1974 general provisions a all activities necessary for or incidental to the operation of the station shall be conducted entirely within the building with the following exceptions 1 emergency services and tire changing  2 dispensing of gasoline and minor service functions customarily performed while dispensing gasoline b all materials goods merchandise parts or supplies both new and used except those necessary for the permitted outside uses outlined under a of this section shall be kept stored or displayed entirely within the building regardless of whether such materials goods merchandise parts or supplies are intended for sale use dispensation or disposal the following shall be permitted provided they conform to all setback lines 1 outside tire cabinets or tire merchandisers for tire display and storage of tires only will be permitted outside the building provided that such cabinets are of a totally enclosed type 2 coinoperated machines for vending of soft drinks cigarettes and similar items will be permitted outside the building provided that such machines are located in an orderly manner 3 trash or refuse storage areas will be permitted outside the building provided that such storage areas are completely screened from view from any point on the perimeter of the site by an enclosure of the same material as the immediate adjacent wall of the station building located immediately adjacent to and attached to the service station building such an enclosure shall extend from ground level to a minimum of five feet  new station construction  application approval or denial procedure  fee a any person intending to build a gasoline station shall apply to the city plan commission for approval to construct such station approval must be obtained prior to making application for a building permit the applicant shall submit to the secretary of the city plan commission an application fee accompanied with plans showing the building elevations display of merchandise storage of supplies storage of refuse and a plot plan of the site showing lot size driveways sign locations aesthetic treatment and parking such fee shall be retained whether or not approval is granted the license fee shall be in an amount as established by the city council from time to time and as set forth in the fee schedule that appears in this b in order to determine if the application is in the public interest the plan commission after holding a public hearing may deny permission to construct a new station if any one or combination of the following conditions is found to exist 1 the use of the site in the judgment of the plan commission for a service station would impair endanger inhibit or in some manner impede the proper flow of vehicular or pedestrian traffic in about or on the street or street upon which such service station fronts 2 the auxiliary service units such as bulk tank trucks and other serving units would in the judgment of the plan commission be inherently dangerous in the geographical location due to population or traffic density or pattern 3 the use of the geographical location in the judgment of the plan commission would be aesthetically unreasonable and would not be compatible with surrounding structures green areas or land uses 4 the proposed station does not comply with all applicable standards presented in this section or with other applicable laws or codes c in determining its finding the plan commission shall take into account the character and use of adjoining buildings and those in the vicinity the number of persons residing or working in such buildings and traffic conditions in the vicinity  abandoned vacant or inoperative stations where the applicant for approval to construct a new station or the person firm or corporation whose products it is intended that the station will dispense owns formerly owned within the past 36 months or controls any abandoned vacant or inoperative station or stations within the city the application for the service station shall be accompanied by an additional fee and a definite and complete plan for the future of the abandoned vacant or inoperative station or stations such plan shall be approved by the city plan commission before or as part of the approval of application for the new station and the commission shall establish a reasonable time limit within which such plan must be carried out the additional fee shall be in an amount as established by the city council from time to time and as set forth in the fee schedule that appears in this the purposes of this section any station which has been abandoned vacant or inoperative for any seven consecutive days in the 60day period prior to the application for a new station or which has been used for other than a gasoline station for any seven consecutive days excluding saturdays sundays and holidays in said 60day period shall be considered to be an abandoned vacant or inoperative station  operative stations  regulation compliance a all operative stations at the time of adoption of the ordinance codified in this article which have been in continual operation for at least 30 days prior to the effective date of the ordinance codified in this article shall comply with the provisions of within two years of the effective date of the ordinance codified in this article b all stations in existence or under construction but not in operation at the time of adoption of the ordinance codified in this article and stations which have not been in continual operation for at least 30 days prior to the adoption of the ordinance codified in this article shall comply with the provisions of before resuming or continuing operations c all stations which are in existence at the effective date of the ordinance codified in this article which do not conform to the provisions of a of this section and b1 3 and  may continue as a nonconforming use if all other provisions are met as described in this section  minimum standards  compliance all stations shall comply with the minimum standards in unless specifically excluded elsewhere in this section  minimum lot area the minimum lot area shall be 10000 square feet for each gasoline dispensing station and 10000 square feet plus 2000 square feet per bay for each gasoline dispensing and service station  minimum lot width the minimum lot width shall be 100 for each gasoline dispensing station and 120 for each gasoline dispensing and service station  parking requirements the parking requirements for gasoline service stations shall be as follows 1 one stall shall be provided for each employee on duty when fully staffed 2 in addition three stalls shall be provided for each bay intended for service repair or other use 3 the minimum size of such stall shall be nine feet by 20 feet  driveway opening no driveway opening shall be located closer than 40 feet to a block corner or closer than 15 feet to a property line no driveway opening shall exceed 35 feet at the curb and 30 feet at the sidewalk line  planted areas a at least ten percent of the gasoline station lot shall be permanently set aside planted and maintained in grass flowers shrubs trees or devoted to other aesthetic treatment acceptable to the plan commission b the area between the sidewalk and the future curbline as shown in the jats plan may be counted as part of the ten percent required but in no case counted as more than five percent although it is not part of the area of the lot upon which the ten percent is computed  location stations except those in the central business zone or industrial zones shall be located only on property fronting on federal state or county highways as such highways are routed and marked within the city  appeals any interested person who feels aggrieved by a decision of the plan commission may appeal from such decision to the city council by serving a notice of appeal in writing upon the city clerk within 20 days from the date of such decision any interested person may appeal from the decision of the city council to the circuit court for rock county wisconsin by filing a notice of appeal in writing with the liquor license advisory committee of said court within 30 days from the date of decision of the city council  to take precedence this article shall take precedence over all other regulations thereto within this the location operation maintenance and regulations of gasoline service stations  secs 1250712536  reserved article xvii  taxicabs footnotes  5  state law reference authority of city to regulate and license taxicabs and taxicab operators wis stats  34924 taxicab company licenserequired no person firm or corporation shall operate any cab taxicab or any other vehicle carrying passengers for hire within the city without first securing a taxicab company license from the city  taxicab company licenseapplication  information required  fee  bond  issuance when a applicants for a taxicab company license pursuant to shall file with the city clerk an application giving the name of such applicant the number of such vehicles to be used or operated and the length of time for which such license is desired and shall pay to the city treasurer the license fee provided in b such application shall be accompanied by a good and sufficient indemnity bond issued by some surety or indemnity company duly authorized to transact business in the state which bond or insurance shall describe each vehicle to be licensed by factory number makers name and carrying capacity said bond or insurance shall provide that the owner or operator issuing the same shall be directly liable for and shall pay all damages whether to persons or property that may be recovered against said owner or operator by reason of the negligent use and operation of each such licensed vehicle for a minimum of $5000000 to any one person or $10000000 for any one accident the bond or insurance provided for by this subsection shall be deemed to include any policy of insurance or other contract in writing by which any surety or insurance company authorized to execute such contract shall assume the liability prescribed in this subsection the city of janesville shall be named as certificate holder for such a bond or insurance and shall be notified if such bond or insurance lapses within five days of the lapse of such bond or insurance if any such bond so filed becomes inoperative or lapses for any reason the vehicle or vehicles covered thereby shall not be operated until a bond meeting the requirements of this subsection has been filed c upon receipt of any such application accompanied by the bond or insurance required by b of this section and payment of the prescribed fee for each taxicab the city clerk shall issue to the applicant a taxicab company license for each taxicab for which application bondinginsurance and fee payment have been made the prescribed fee shall be in an amount as established by the city council from time to time and as set forth in the fee schedule that appears in this issued license shall bear the signature of the city clerk any denial of a new or renewal application or issuance by the city clerk for any reason may be appealed within 30 days of the denial by the applicant to the city council by filing a written appeal signed by the applicant setting forth in detail the reasons why the taxicab company license should be issued upon such filing the matter shall be placed upon the agenda of the next regularly scheduled meeting of the city council the applicant shall be provided an opportunity to appear and under oath present evidence and testimony as to why the license should be issued and the city clerk shall be provided an opportunity to show why the license should not be issued each party may provide testimony present witnesses and crossexamine witnesses a majority vote of the city councilmembers present at the hearing shall govern and a tie vote sustains the city clerks decision to not issue the license  taxicab company licenseinformation required  register kept  exhibited  additional vehicles each taxicab company license shall be numbered and dated and shall contain the name of the person applying for the same it shall be the duty of the city clerk to keep a register of all licenses granted under this article wherein shall be stated the number of such license to whom issued and the date thereof every person firm or corporation who may be licensed as aforesaid shall forthwith cause the license number to be plainly exhibited on the right and left side of each vehicle so operated in figures not less than 1 inches in height where any licensee operates more than one such vehicle all vehicles operated by such licensee shall be individually numbered consecutively from one to the total number of such vehicles and on each such vehicle there shall be exhibited on each side thereof in letters of like size the individual vehicle number in addition to the license number such vehicle number and license number shall be separated by a dash  taxicab company licenserented or leased vehicles this article shall require a taxicab company license for every vehicle which may be leased or rented for use as a taxicab with or without a driver  municipal taxicab drivers licenserequired no person other than a licensed driver holding a municipal taxicab drivers license issued by the city shall operate any cab taxicab or any other vehicle covered by carrying passengers for hire within the city limits  municipal taxicab drivers licenseapplication  fee  information required  denied when  receipt  council determination a applicants for a municipal taxicab drivers license shall file an application with the city clerk and shall pay a license fee in an amount as established by the city council from time to time and as set forth in the fee schedule that appears in this application shall state the applicants name age physical description the person firm or company for whom the applicant is to drive and any convictions in any court of record for any offense within the previous five years two passportsize photos shall be submitted with each application one of which will be retained by the city clerks office and the other will be attached to the license when issued no such license shall be issued to any person under the age of 18 years nor shall any license be granted to any applicant who has been convicted of driving while under the influence of intoxicants or other related violations within one year prior to the date of filing such application applicants must possess a valid drivers license issued by the state in which they reside be eligible to drive in wisconsin and have no current wisconsin revocations or suspensions of driving privileges b upon receipt of an application and presentation of a receipt showing the payment of the prescribed fee only if the applicant satisfies all of the requirements set forth in a of this section and all of the other requirements for taxicab drivers and drivers license applications set forth of this article and only if issuance is recommended by the chief of police the city clerk shall issue to the applicant a taxicab drivers license to said applicant the issued license shall be dated contain the name of the licensee and be signed by the city clerk an application for a new or renewal taxicab drivers license may be denied due to the applicants regular or cdl driver license or taxicab drivers license related history of drug or alcohol violations andor recent within five years moving traffic violations andor other related offenses when in the discretion of the city clerk or chief of police it is deemed necessary andor appropriate to deny said application for the public safety welfare peace good order andor health of the community any denial of the application or issuance by the city clerk for any reason may be appealed by the applicant to the city council within 30 days of the denial by filing a written appeal signed by the applicant setting forth in detail the reasons why the taxicab driver license should be issued upon such filing the matter shall be placed upon the agenda of the next regularly scheduled meeting of the city council the applicant shall be provided an opportunity to appear and under oath present evidence and testimony as to why the license should be issued and the city clerk shall be provided an opportunity to show why the license should not be issued each party may provide testimony present witnesses and crossexamine witnesses a majority vote of the city councilmembers present at the hearing shall govern and a tie vote sustains the city clerks decision to not issue the license  municipal taxicab drivers licenseexemptions the provisions in this article requiring taxicab drivers to be licensed shall not apply to persons operating such vehicles under a permit for special occasions as provided in this article  municipal taxicab drivers licensenontransferable no municipal taxicab drivers license shall be transferable  municipal taxicab drivers licensedisplay required all persons mandated by this article to have a municipal taxicab drivers license shall have and keep the same displayed in a conspicuous place on the inside of the vehicle within clear view of all passengers  fares  display in cab required all persons mandated by this article to have a municipal taxicab drivers license shall at all times conspicuously and legibly post and display their fares fees and other charges in writing inside the cab within clear view of all passengers  special occasion permitrequirements the city clerk may issue to any person firm or corporation a permit to operate a cab taxicab or other conveyance carrying passengers for hire for any special day of occasion subject to the conditions in  special occasion permitapplication fee  treasurers receipt  information required  display applications for special permits must be made to the city clerk and the same must be accompanied by a payment of a fee in an amount as established by the city council from time to time and as set forth in the fee schedule that appears in this applicant must state the number of vehicles to be operated by such driver and the names of persons who are to act as drivers such permit shall not be issued for any vehicle unless the city clerk is satisfied that the driver thereof is a fit person to operate the same such special permit shall bear the date for which it is issued contain the name of the driver and be signed by the city clerk a separate permit shall be issued for each vehicle to be used such permit shall be displayed within clear view of all passengers  special occasion permitbonding procedure each applicant for any special permit shall file with the city clerk an indemnity bond to cover each vehicle to be operated under such permit in the same manner and amount as prescribed in  special occasion permitoperator to be licensed or listed in permit  effective date no special permit fee shall be required for the operation of any licensed vehicle on any such special occasion but all drivers of any vehicle whether licensed or operating under permit for special occasion must either be licensed or included and listed in the application for said permit and approved by the city clerk each such special permit shall state the day for which it is issued and shall have no force or effect on any other day  licenses and permitsrevocation when in addition to the penalties prescribed in the city council may at any time revoke any taxicab company or municipal taxicab drivers license or special permit provided for in this article when in its discretion public safety requires such revocation a municipal taxicab drivers license is automatically revoked for the period of one year upon the licensees conviction of driving a vehicle while under the influence of intoxicants or controlled substances or upon suspension or revocation of the licensees state operating privileges  exceptions the provisions of this article shall not apply to vehicles which are owned by licensed funeral directors nor to the drivers of such vehicles when employed by such licensed funeral directors in the conduct of funerals weddings and christenings any such vehicles and the drivers thereof shall be licensed as required by this article if used in any other class of work furthermore every vehicle and the driver thereof must be licensed even though the same is employed in the conduct of a funeral wedding or christening if such vehicle is not owned by a licensed funeral director  violation  penalty a any person firm or corporation violating any of the provisions of this article shall upon conviction therefor in court have his her or its license revoked andor suspended and shall pay to the city a forfeiture in the amount of not less than $10000 nor more than $100000 together with the costs of prosecution and in default of the payment of such forfeiture and costs the violator shall be imprisoned in the county jail until such forfeiture and costs are paid not to exceed 60 days b each days continuance of any violation constitutes a separate offense c a violation of any provision of this article by an employee agent or taxicab driver shall constitute a violation of and by the owner licensee andor taxicab company d in addition to and not in lieu of any other forfeitures or penalties set forth in this article the city may seek andor the court may impose injunctive relief in favor of the city and against any violation of this article e penalties shall be independent and in addition to the right of the city council to revoke or suspend any license or permit granted under this article  secs 1255412584  reserved article xviii  weights and measurements program footnotes provisions of wis stats  9804 inclusive of the wisconsin statutes and any applicable wisconsin administrative codes each as from time to time amended and renumbered describing and defining regulations and procedures with respect to weights and measurements are hereby adopted and by reference made a part of this article as if fully set forth herein any act required to be performed or prohibited by any statute or code so incorporated by reference is required or prohibited by this article any future amendments revisions or modifications of such statutes and administrative codes incorporated by this article are also adopted and incorporated herein  definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning commercial weighing device or measuring device means those devices used or employed in establishing the size quantity extent area or measurement of quantities things produce or articles for sale hire or award or in computing any basic charge or payment for goods or services rendered on the basis of weight or measure occasional sale means an isolated and sporadic sale which takes place where the infrequency in relation to the other circumstances support the inference that the seller is not pursuing a vocation occupation or business or a partial vocation or occupation or parttime business as a vendor of items subject to weights and measures as covered by this article such occasional sale shall be for special events or temporary events operating infrequently and not at a regular andor permanent location for conducting transactions requiring the use of weighing or measuring devices testing entity means the city of janesville or any other person business organization or any other entity including the state of wisconsin under contract with the city of janesville that provides testing and related services for the city of janesville weights and measures program weights and measures program means and includes the administration and enforcement of this article and wis stats  9804 and any related sections and wisconsin administrative as from time to time amended and renumbered  participation required a except as provided in subsections b and c of this section each and every person corporation limited liability corporation limited liability partnership business group organization or other entity who holds owns possesses operates andor maintains weights and measures weighing or measuring devices andor systems and accessories relating thereto which are used commercially within the city of janesville in determining the weight measure count or cost of commodities or things sold or offered or exposed for sale on the basis of weight measure or count is deemed to be a participant in the city of janesville weights and measures program subject to the provisions of this article b occasional sales are exempt from the provisions of this article c devices tested under the jurisdiction of another municipality or a noncity of janesville related testing program by the state of wisconsin and used temporarily in the city of janesville for no more than five consecutive days per year are exempt under this section from the provisions of this article  assessmentscostsfees a the city of janesville clerktreasurer andor his or her designee shall annually assess costs and fees to each participant holding owning possessing operating andor maintaining such devices and utilizing the services provided in this article based on the number of weighing and measuring devices held as of the date of the last inspection and testing of such devices such assessments shall be determined no later than 90 days from the receipt of any billing received by the city of janesville from the state of wisconsin or other testing entity relating to weights and measurement testing and calibration the total of the costs and fees assessed and collected shall not exceed the actual costs of the weights and measures program billed to the city together with a 15 percent city administration cost which shall be added thereto such total assessment shall then be divided and assessed proportionally against each and every person corporation limited liability corporation limited liability partnership business group organization or other entity tested which gave rise to the citys expense b the city of janesville clerktreasurer andor his or her designee shall prepare a statement of assessments and mail to each participant said statement together with an invoice for the amount of the participants assessment invoices shall be mailed by first class mail no later than 30 days after the assessments have been determined as set forth in a of this section this will be the perdevice fee the charge to each participant shall be based on the total number of devices it holds owns possesses operates or maintains multiplied by the proportionately distributed individual assessment amount c each and every participant who is subject to inspection and testing andor holds owns possesses operates or maintains devices subject to inspection and testing is subject to this article liable for said assessment and the payment of such assessments and shall pay to the city of janesville the fee assessed no later than 30 days from the date the invoice is mailed d schedules statements notices and invoices shall be considered mailed to a participant when mailed by first class mail to the location where the device was held owned possessed operated maintained andor tested  nonpayment  noncompliance  enforcement in the event that the assessed fee is not paid in full by the assessed participant within 30 days of the mailing of the invoice the clerktreasurer may charge and levy the amount of such unpaid assessment or part thereof or allocate such unpaid assessment against the participants tax bill if not paid before the next immediately following october 1 any assessment fee or part thereof not paid within 30 days of invoicing shall accrue interest at the rate of one percent per month upon the outstanding delinquency until paid in full in addition failure to pay within the 30 days of the mailing of the invoice constitutes a violation of this article  violations  penalties a any person who violates any of the provisions of this article shall forfeit and pay to the city as and for a penalty a forfeiture in the following dollar amounts together with the costs of prosecution for each offense and in default of the payment of such penalty shall be imprisoned for not more than 60 days for each unpaid forfeiture in addition to such other penalties remedies sanctions and relief as may be from time to time provided by law 1 for a first offense a forfeiture of not less than $3000 but not more than $50000 2 for a second offense a forfeiture of not less than $5000 but not more than $50000 3 for a third offense a forfeiture of not less than $7500 but not more than $50000 4 for a fourth offense a forfeiture of not less than $10000 but not more than $50000 5 in addition to the imposition of forfeiture the city may request and the court may grant injunctive relief abatement mandamus and such other equitable relief and orders as the court may deem appropriate to terminate the violations b each occurrence shall constitute a separate violation c each days continuance of a violation shall constitute a separate offense  secs 1259112613  reserved article xix  food 1262312652  reserved article xx  cable television franchise short title this article shall be known and may be cited as the cable television franchise   definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning gross revenues of a grantee means and includes 1 any and all direct and indirect revenues of any grantee including but not limited to any and all annual gross revenues income commissions remunerations compensation capital gains other gains receipts benefits payments earnings recompense restitution settlements gifts andor reparation of whatsoever kind or nature howsoever derived andor received directly or indirectly by any grantee in connection with and applicable to the operation of the janesville cable television system including but not limited to basic service tier extended basic monthly subscriber service fees pay cable fees installation fees reconnection fees late charges commissions derived from home shopping advertising advertising commissions rental of converters rental of remotes any and all other rental income and any and all other sources of income of whatsoever kind or nature 2 the term gross revenues does not include any taxes or services furnished by any grantee and imposed directly upon any subscriber or user by the city state or other governmental unit and collected by any grantee on behalf of said governmental unit gross receipts means all revenues received by and paid to a video service provider by subscribers residing within the city for video service or received from advertisers including all of the following 1 recurring charges for video service 2 eventbased charges for video service including payperview and videoondemand charges 3 rental of set top boxes and other video service equipment 4 service charges related to the provision of video service including activation installation repair and maintenance charges 5 administrative charges related to the provision of video service including service order and service termination charges 6 revenues received from the provision of home shopping or similar programming 7 all revenue except for refunds rebates and discounts derived by the video service provider for advertising over its video service network to subscribers within the city if such revenue is derived under a regional or national compensation contract or arrangement between the video service provider and one or more advertisers or advertising representatives the amount of revenue derived for the city shall be determined by multiplying the total revenue derived under the contract or arrangement by the percentage resulting from dividing the number of subscribers in the city by the total number of regional or national subscribers that potentially receive the advertising under the contract or arrangement notwithstanding subsections 17 of this definition the term gross receipts does not include any of the following 1 discounts refunds and other price adjustments that reduce the amount of compensation received by a video service provider 2 uncollectible fees except that any uncollectible fees that are written off as bad debt but subsequently collected shall be included as gross receipts in the period collected less the expenses of collection 3 late payment charges 4 amounts billed to video service subscribers to recover taxes fees surcharges or assessments of general applicability or otherwise collected by a video service provider from video service subscribers for pass any federal state or local government agency including video service provider fees and regulatory fees paid to the fcc under 47 usc 159 as from time to time amended or renumbered 5 revenue from the sale of capital assets or surplus equipment not used by the purchaser to receive video service from the seller of those assets or surplus equipment 6 charges other than those described in 1 of this definition that are aggregated or bundled with amounts described in 1 of this definition including but not limited to any revenues received by a video service provider or its affiliates for telecommunications services information services or the provision of directory or internet advertising including yellow pages white pages banner advertisement and electronic publishing if a video service provider can reasonably identify such charges on books and records kept in the regular course of business or by other reasonable means 7 reimbursement by programmers of marketing costs actually incurred by a video service provider  incorporation of federal and state laws a each and every federal and state law pertaining to andor regulating the cable television industry and local government involvement and empowerment thereto are hereby adopted by reference and incorporated herein as if fully set forth b each and every act and prohibition required therein are required by this article unless a provision in this article andor in any franchise agreement between the city and a grantee provides otherwise in which event the provision in this article andor franchise agreement shall govern to the extent permitted by law  violation  penalty a in addition to and not in lieu abrogation or diminishment of any and all remedies and penalties set forth elsewhere in this article upon any violation by a grantee andor other person of any provision of this article such grantee andor person shall forfeit and pay to the city a sum of not less than $10000 nor more than $100000 for each violation together with the costs of prosecution b each days continuance of a violation shall constitute a separate violation c in addition to and not in lieu abrogation or diminishment of imposition of the forfeitures set forth above and in addition to and not in lieu abrogation or diminishment of any or all remedies andor penalties set forth elsewhere in this article  upon a violation of any provision set forth in this article the grantee andor other person shall be subject to and the city may seek the grant and imposition of one andor more equitable andor legal order of the court including but not limited to injunction and mandamus in order to effectuate and achieve compliance performance abatement andor such other legitimate public interest d prior to the imposition of a penalty hereunder the city shall provide a grantee with a 30day notice and a right to cure the violation upon which such penalty is to be imposed in the event of a failure to cure by a grantee within such 30 days the penalty shall accrue from the first day of such violation  secs 1265712690  reserved article xxi  cable television basic rates violation  penalty a in addition to this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning hotel or motel means a building or group of buildings in which the public may obtain accommodations for a consideration including without limitation such establishments as inns motels tourist homes tourist houses or courts lodginghouses roominghouses summer camps apartment hotels resort lodges and cabins and any other building or group of buildings in which accommodations are available to the public exempt from the definition of the term hotel or motel are mobile homes as defined in wis stats  1d and accommodations rented for a continuous period of more than one month and accommodations furnished by any hospitals sanitoriums or nursing homes or by corporations or associations organized and operated exclusively for religious charitable or educational purposes provided that no part of the net earnings of such corporations and associations inures to the benefit of any private shareholder or individual transient means any person residing for a continuous period of less than one month in a hotel motel or other furnished accommodations available to the public  annual room tax a pursuant to applicable provision of the currently wis stats  6675 a tax is imposed on the privilege and service of furnishing at retail of rooms or lodging to transients by hotel keepers motel operators and other persons furnishing accommodations that are available to the public pursuant to the above definitions irrespective of whether membership is required for the use of the accommodations b such annual room tax shall be at the rate of eight percent of the gross receipts from such retail furnishing of rooms or lodgings c such tax shall not be subject to the selective sales tax imposed by wis stats  77522a1  administration  returns a this article shall be administered by the city clerk b each person governed by this article shall have the following reporting period amount of room tax due reporting period less than $30000 per year annual at least $30000 per year but not more than $60000 in any one quarter quarterly more than $60000 in any one quarter monthly c a room tax return shall be filed with the city clerk and the room tax imposed by this article shall be due and payable in full to the city no later than the last day of the month immediately following that persons reporting period except that those persons whose room tax liability is greater than $360000 per quarter shall file their room tax return no later than the 20th day of the month immediately following the end of their reporting period d the room tax return shall be in a form as required by the city clerk and shall show among other items the gross receipts derived from the retail furnishing of rooms and lodging for that reporting period the amount of taxes imposed for such period and such other information as the city clerk or his or her representative deems necessary provided it is directly related to the tax the city clerk may for good cause extend the time of filing any return but no longer than 30 days from the original filing due date e each room tax return shall be signed by the person required to file such return or his or her duly authorized agent the city clerk may for good cause extend the time of filing any return but not longer than 30 days from the filing date f for administration expenses in reporting the room tax and the accounting connected therewith any person liable for any amount of tax imposed by this article may deduct two percent of the room tax due provided that the payment of the tax is not delinquent  successors responsibility for tax payment a if any person liable for any amount of tax imposed by this article in any manner in whole or in part terminates transfers conveys sells gifts or divides his or her business stock of goods his or her successor or assign shall withhold sufficient sums from the purchase price to fully and completely satisfy the tax imposed by this article b such withheld sum shall be due and payable in full to the city clerk upon demand c each such assignee and successor is personally liable and responsible to the city of janesville for the full amount of such transferors unpaid room tax  officefield audit determination a the city clerk or city finance director or representatives acting on their behalf may by office or field audit determine the tax required to be paid to the city or the refund due any person under this article b such office or field audit determination may include any and all information obtained by the city clerk or the city finance director or representative acting on their behalf may be without cause may be in the manner prescribed by the city clerk or city finance director and may occur as often as deemed necessary by either the city clerk or city finance director c each person governed by this article shall present to the city clerk city finance director or representative acting on their behalf any and all information data documents financial records receipts and papers of whatever kind and nature requested by the city clerk city finance director or representatives acting on their behalf within five working days of such request d nothing herein shall prevent either the city clerk or the city finance director from making a determination of the tax or the tax due at any time  failure to file return  estimate and penalty a if any persons fail to file a return as required by this article the city clerk shall make an estimate of the amount of the gross receipts under b such estimate shall be made for the period for which such person failed to make a return and shall be based upon any information which is in the city clerks possession or which may come into his or her possession c on the basis of this estimate the city clerk shall compute and determine the amount required to be paid to the city adding to the sum the interest as set forth in  interest rate a all unpaid taxes imposed by this article shall bear interest at the rate of 12 percent per annum b interest shall be imposed from the due date of the tax payment until the day on which the tax is paid or deposited with the city clerk an extension of time within which to file the return shall not operate to extend the due date of the return for the purposes of interest computation c all refunded taxes shall bear interest at the same rate computed from the due date of the return until the day on which said taxes are refunded d if the city clerk determines that any overpayment of tax has been made intentionally or by reason of carelessness or neglect or if the tax which was overpaid was not accompanied by a properly completed return or if information requested was not provided within the time set forth above no interest shall be allowed upon the refund of the overpaid tax  delinquent returns  taxevasion a the tax imposed by this section shall become delinquent if not paid within 30 days after the due date of the return or within 30 days after the expiration of an extension period if one has been granted if a return is filed late or there is no return filed the due date for the taxes imposed is the due date of the return b no person may fail to file a return when due or file an intentionally false or fraudulent return  security deposit a in order to protect the revenue of the city the city clerk may require that a taxpayer who has had prior delinquencies and is liable for the tax imposed by this article to place with the city security in an amount equal to the taxpayers average monthly tax due over the period of the previous 12 months but in no case less than $50000 b upon a delinquency in the payment of the taxes imposed by this article the city clerk may upon ten days notice recover the taxes interest and penalties from such security c no interest shall be paid or allowed by the city to any person for the deposit of such security  recordkeeping a each person governed by this article shall keep or cause to be kept adequate financial and other records receipts invoices and related papers and documents sufficient to accurately establish revenues and tax liabilities imposed by this article b each person governed by this article shall keep or cause to be kept adequate financial and other records receipts invoices and related papers and documents as required by the city clerk  confidentialitywho may have access to information a all returns schedules exhibits writing or audit reports relating to such returns on file with the city are deemed to be confidential except the city clerk may divulge their contents to the following and no others b persons using the information in the discharge of duties imposed by law or the duties of their office or by order of a court  confidentialityresponsibility of administrators no person having an administrative duty under this article or having access lawfully or unlawfully to information provided to the city under this article shall make known in any manner the business affairs operations or information obtained by an investigation of records of any person on whom a tax is imposed by this article or the amount or source of income profits losses expenditures or any particular thereof set forth or disclosed in any return or permit any return or copy thereof to be seen or examined by any person except as provided in  expenditure of room tax revenues collected in accordance with wis stats  66751md2 as from time to time amended or registration fee authority this article is adopted pursuant to the authority granted by wis stats  34135 as from time to time amended or renumbered  purpose the purpose of this article is to provide the city of janesville a source of revenue in addition to other revenue sources currently being utilized to maintain public streets highways and for all other transportationrelated purposes  definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning motor vehicle means an automobile or motor truck registered under wis stats  341251c at a gross weight of not more than 8000 pounds  imposition of motor vehicle registration fee a pursuant to wis stats  34135 an annual flat city registration fee is hereby imposed upon all motor vehicles registered in the state of wisconsin that are customarily kept in the city the annual flat registration fee will be in an amount as established by the city council from time to time and set forth in the fee schedule that appears in this b this fee shall be paid by the registration applicant at the time that a motor vehicle is first registered and at each time of registration renewal c the city registration fee shall be paid as provided in wis stats  341355 d the city registration fee shall be in addition to state registration fees  administrative costs wisdot shall retain a portion of the monies collected equal to the actual administrative costs related to the collection of these fees the method for computing the administrative costs will be reviewed annually by wisdot as provided in wis stats  34135  exemptions the following motor vehicles are exempt from the annual janesville vehicle registration fee 1 all vehicles exempted by wis stats ch 341 from payment of a state vehicle registration fee 2 all vehicles registered by the state under wis stats  34126 for a fee of $500  replacements no city vehicle registration fee may be imposed on a motor vehicle which is a replacement for a motor vehicle for which a current city vehicle registration fee has been paid  deposit of fee revenues  administration a all monies under the applicable statute and this article remitted to the city by the wisconsin department of transportation or other applicable agency shall be deposited into the citys general fund and special revenue fund b the city clerktreasurer shall be responsible for the administration of this article and funds c this article and its fees shall take effect at requiring   i 2262018  fire and fire prevention article i  in general secs 1611618  reserved article ii  fire hazards theaters hotels and nursing homes footnotes  1  state law reference regulations prohibiting smoking in enclosed places wis stats   theaters and auditoriumssmoking prohibited  exceptions  fire department inspection and approval no person shall light a match or other flameproducing device or smoke or carry a lighted cigar cigarette or pipe in any theater motion picture theater or auditorium while the same is being used as a theater or place of entertainment except in areas designated as areas in which smoking may be permitted which areas shall be free of all flammable and combustible floors walls furniture fixtures and decorations no such area shall be used for smoking until after the same has been inspected and approved by the chief of the fire department  theaters and auditoriumsno smoking announcement required  signs to be posted it shall be the duty of the operator or local manager of such theater or motion picture theater or place of entertainment before the beginning of each performance to announce from the stage or by projection on the screen that smoking is prohibited by local ordinance except in approved areas if there are any and to further erect signs approved by the chief of the fire department stating that smoking is prohibited by ordinance except in approved areas  theaters and auditoriumssmoking violation when  manager action  exceptions whenever a patron is observed smoking in violation of it shall be the duty of the operator or theater manager or manager of such place of entertainment and of the employees of such theater motion picture theater or place of entertainment to notify such person of the violation and to use their best efforts to prevent such violation this section and shall not be construed to prohibit the use of a cigar cigarette or pipe upon the stage of any such theater when used in connection with any such performance under proper safeguards  hotels homes for the aged and nursing or convalescent homesdefinitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning home for the aged means any institution public or private or any residence except county homes to which aged persons are admitted for residence and whose principal business is furnishing board room laundry and care hotel means all places wherein sleeping accommodations are offered for pay to transients nursing or convalescent home means any institution public or private or residence except county homes in which there is provided nursing or convalescent care  hotels homes for the aged and nursing or convalescent homesfuture regulations are in addition to any future regulations on hotels homes for the aged and nursing or convalescent homes  hotels  responsible person on premises when  hourly inspections any person firms or corporation operating a hotel having 30 or more rooms available for sleeping accommodations shall at all times between the hours of  pm to  am each night have some responsible person on duty and awake on the premises as a precaution against fire and other hazards during the hours of  pm to  am hourly inspections shall be made of all floors of such premises including the basement as a further precaution against fire and other hazards  home for the aged nursing or convalescent home  responsible person on duty  hourly inspections any person firm or corporation operating a home for the aged or a nursing or convalescent home having 20 or more patients including those who may be roomers as long as there are patients in residence receiving nursing or convalescent care shall at all times between the hours of  pm to  am each night have some responsible person on duty and awake on the premises as a precaution against fire and other hazards during the hours of  pm to  am hourly inspections shall be made of all floors of such premises including the basement as a further precaution against fire and other hazards  smoking unlawful when  notice posted a no person by smoking or attempting to light or to smoke cigarettes cigars pipes or tobacco in any manner in which lighters or matches are employed shall in a careless reckless or negligent manner set fire to any bedding furniture curtains drapes or household fittings located in any of the following enumerated buildings or to any of the following buildings namely hotels roominghouses lodginghouses or other places of public abode b in each sleeping room of such buildings a plainly printed notice shall be kept posted in a conspicuous place advising tenants of the regulation set out in this section or of the corresponding statutory regulation  violation  penalty any person who violates any of the provisions of this article shall be subject to the enforcement and penalty
