of such plastic pipe sold shall be clearly labeled with such appropriate warning affixed thereto  offenses footnotes  1  state law reference municipal authority to prohibit conduct similar to state criminal statutes wis stats    local regulation of firearms wis stats    public safety offenses wis stats ch 941  offenses involving property rights wis stats ch 943  crimes against government and its administration wis stats ch 946  crimes against public peace and order wis stats ch 947 article i  in general division 1  generally secs 2412418  reserved division 2  fire department regulations footnotes  2  state law reference fire regulations generally wis stats  94110 et seq emergency vehiclesrightofway allowed when fire department personnel with their fire or emergency apparatus of every kind when going to or on duty at a fire or when responding to any other emergency and the operators thereof are sounding audible signals by siren shall have the rightofway over all other vehicles the operator of any vehicle whether motor or otherwise upon the approach of such fire or emergency apparatus shall immediately operate the same to a position as near as possible and parallel to the righthand edge or curb of the roadway clear of any intersection of highways and shall stop and remain in such position unless otherwise directed by a traffic officer until such authorized emergency vehicle shall have passed prior 061a   emergency vehiclessubject to standard traffic regulations when except when actually responding to a fire alarm or other emergency call or when on duty at a fire the apparatus and vehicles of the fire department shall have no special rightofway or special privileges of any kind but shall be subject to all traffic regulations the same as other vehicles prior 061b   driving over fire hose forbidden no person shall ride any bicycle or motorcycle or drive any automobile wagon or other vehicle of any kind over any fire hose which may be in use by the fire department in any street or public highway in the city no person shall trample on such hose or cause or permit any horse or other beast of burden which may be in his or her charge to trample on such hose when in use by the fire department prior 062   false alarm and interference with equipment forbidden no person shall knowingly turn in or otherwise give a false alarm of fire or interfere with any of the poles wires alarm boxes keys to alarm boxes or other apparatus appertaining to the fire alarm system or make or cause to be made any key to any alarm box or other part of such system or mutilate or destroy any notice affixed to any part of the same prior 063   vicinity limits  turning off electrical and gas during a fire the chief or other officer in command may prescribe certain limits in the vicinity of any fire within which any persons excepting firefighters and police officers and those admitted by order of any officer of the fire department shall not be permitted to come and shall have the power to cause the removal of any property whenever it shall become necessary for the preservation of such property from fire or to prevent the spreading of fire or to protect the adjoining property the chief or other officer in command shall also have the power to cause the removal of all wires and the turning off of all electricity andor gas where the same interferes with the work of the fire department during the progress of a fire prior 064   bystanders subject to fire department authorities  duties  failure to obey orders every person who may be present at a fire shall be subject to the orders of the chief or other officer in command and it shall be the duty of every such person to render such assistance as may be ordered by the officer in charge any person refusing to obey any such order after the official status of the officer is made known to him shall be punished as provided in prior 065   authority for fire department to enter adjacent property  interference unlawful it is lawful for any firefighter while acting under the order or direction of the chief or other officer in command to enter upon the premises adjacent to or in the vicinity of any building or other property then on fire for the purpose of extinguishing such fire in case any person hinders resists or obstructs any firefighter in the discharge of his or her duty as is provided in this section the person so offending shall be deemed guilty of resisting a firefighter in the discharge of their duty prior 066   removal or injury of equipment forbidden no person except as duly authorized by the chief or other officer in charge shall take or remove from any fire station any of the property or equipment of the department no person shall maliciously injure or destroy any property of the department no part of the fire apparatus or emergency apparatus operated by the fire department shall be taken outside of the city except for fire or emergency purposes in accordance with plans and schedules established by the city manager and chief of the fire department prior 067   loitering about fire station forbidden no person who is not a member of the fire department shall loiter in any fire station or about the doors thereof or upon the sidewalks in front of such station without the consent of the chief or other officer then in command at such station prior 068   violation  penalty any person who violates any of the provisions of this division shall pay to the city a forfeiture not exceeding $5000 together with the costs of prosecution for each offense and each day during which any such violation continues shall be deemed a separate offense in default of the payment of such penalty the violator shall be imprisoned in the county jail not to exceed 30 days prior 12   secs 24292459  reserved division 3  advertising on government buses limitations no bus owned by or operated for or on behalf of a governmental unit whose jurisdiction geographically is not greater than rock county wisconsin shall carry show or present any advertising for or concerning any of the following subjects 1 candidates for city council or school board  2 referendum on which only city or school district electors will vote prior 19     1974 violation  penalty any person who violates any of the provisions in this division shall forfeit and pay to the city a penalty not exceeding $10000 together with the costs of prosecution for each offense and each day during which any such violation continues is deemed a separate offense in default of payment of such penalty the violator shall be imprisoned in the county jail not to exceed 30 days prior 17   secs 24622480  reserved article ii  offenses against public decency division 1  generally secs 248124103  reserved division 2  accommodation and employment declaration of policy  purpose and intent a a vibrant productive and economically successful city is made possible by the talents contributions and wellbeing of its diverse residents it is the policy of the city of janesville that equal rights of all those who live and work in the city are assured and that equal rights and equal opportunity within the context of the larger commercial and social fabric of the janesville community are promoted b the practice of providing equal opportunity in employment and public accommodations to persons without regard to actual or perceived race color creed religion national origin ancestry age sexgender disability arrestconviction record marital status sexual orientation gender identity andor gender expression results of genetic testing honesty testing pregnancy or childbirth military service or an individuals affiliation with or perceived affiliation with any of these protected categories is a desirable goal of the city of janesville and a matter of legitimate concern to its government discrimination against any of janesvilles residents or visitors endangers the rights and privileges of all and deprives the community of the fullest productive capacity of those of its members so discriminated against and denies to them the sufficiency of earnings necessary for maintaining the standard of living consistent with their abilities and talents c provision for adequate safeguards against discrimination is a proper and necessary function of city government to protect the health safety and general welfare of all inhabitants of the city and all persons employed and living within the city it is declared to be the public policy of this city to foster and enforce to the fullest extent of the law equal opportunity employment and public accommodations without regard to actual or perceived race color creed religion national origin ancestry age sexgender disability arrestconviction record marital status sexual orientation gender identity andor gender expression results of genetic testing honesty testing pregnancy or childbirth military service or an individuals affiliation with or perceived affiliation with any of these protected categories to fully effectuate this policy of promoting nondiscrimination the city shall endeavor to eliminate all discrimination that may occur within employment and accommodation within the city of janesville d where applicable this article shall be interpreted and applied consistently with the provisions of title viii of the civil rights act of 196 42 usc section 3601 et seq 24 cfr 100 et seq and wis stats   10650 and 11131 and any successor provisions of state and federal law  definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning age means being age 40 years or older ancestry means the country nation tribe or other identifiable group from which one descends arrestconviction record means information indicating a person was questioned arrested charged or convicted of a felony or misdemeanor an employer may reject an applicant or fire an employee whose conviction is substantially related to the job color means color of skin disability means with respect to a person any of the following 1 a physical or mental impairment which substantially limits one or more of the persons major life activities 2 a record of having an impairment or being regarded as having such an impairment 3 the term disability does not include current illegal use of or addition to a controlled substance the behavioral manifestations of a mental disability may be taken into consideration in determining whether or not the applicant is qualified discriminate discrimination or discriminatory means any act policy advertisement or practice which regardless of intent has the effect of subjecting any person to differential treatment as a result of that persons actual or perceived race color creed religion national origin ancestry age sexgender disability arrestconviction record marital status sexual orientation gender identity andor gender expression results of genetic testing honesty testing pregnancy or childbirth and military service discrimination also includes any differential treatment because of ones association with a person or group of people identified herein employee means any individual employed or seeking employment from an employer employer means any person who for compensation regularly employs five or more individuals not including the employers parents spouse or children for purposes of this division an employer is also any person acting on behalf of an employer directly or indirectly or any employment agency gender identity andor gender expression means a persons genderrelated selfidentity appearance expression or behavior regardless of the persons assigned sex at birth marital status means the status of being married single divorced separated or widowed military service means service in the us armed forces the state defense force the national guard of any state or any other reserve component of the us armed forces national origin means generally a member of a nation by origin birth or naturalization or having common origins person means any natural person firm corporation partnership or other organization association or group of persons however arranged place of public accommodation includes all establishments within the city of janesville which offers goods services accommodations and entertainment to the public a place of public accommodation does not include any institution or club which by its nature is distinctly private race means generally a member of a group united or classified together on the basis of common history nationality or geography religion or creed means a system of religious beliefs including moral or ethical beliefs about right and wrong that are sincerely held with the strength of traditional religious views sexgender means being female or male sexual orientation means a persons actual or perceived heterosexuality homosexuality asexuality or bisexuality  prohibited acts of discrimination  employment a with regard to employment it shall be unlawful for any employers or labor organizations to engage in any of the following acts wholly or partially for a discriminatory reason 1 to discriminate against any individual with respect to failure to hire refusal to hire discharge compensation terms conditions or privileges of employment including promotion  however nothing in this subsection shall be construed to require any employer to provide benefits such as insurance to individuals not employed by the employer  2 to limit segregate or classify employees in any way which would deprive or tend to deprive any employee of employment opportunities or which would otherwise tend to adversely affect his or her status as an employee  or 3 to fail or refuse to refer for employment or to give negative information to a potential employer of any individual in such a manner that would deprive or limit an individuals employment opportunities or that would otherwise adversely affect an individuals status as an applicant or prospective employee b employers shall post in a conspicuous place upon its premises a poster prepared and made available by the city relating to the prohibition regarding discrimination based upon gender identity or gender expression  prohibited acts of discrimination  business establishment or public accommodations it shall be unlawful for a business establishment or place of public accommodation to deny directly or indirectly any person the full enjoyment of the goods services facilities privileges advantages and accommodations wholly or partially for a discriminatory reason  jurisdiction a the city of janesville shall not exercise jurisdiction over any complaint that sets forth or states any facts or allegations that are subject matter within the jurisdiction of any state or federal agency including but not limited to the us equal employment opportunity commission or the state of wisconsin department of workforce development regardless of whether the complainant has chosen to file with that said agency or not when a complaint or inquiry is presented to the city manager or to designated staff and it appears that the city does not have jurisdiction as indicated above the complainant shall be referred to the appropriate state or federal enforcement agencies b it shall not be an unlawful discriminatory practice for an employer to observe the conditions of a bona fide seniority system or a bona fide employee benefit system based on age such as a retirement pension or insurance plan which is not a subterfuge or pretext to evade the purposes of this division c nothing contained in this division shall be deemed to prohibit selection or rejection based solely upon a bona fide occupational qualification a bona fide physical requirement or as to a religious or denominational institution based upon a preference for applicants of the same religion or denomination  enforcement a any person who claims to have been injured under this division may file a written complaint with the city manager or designee setting forth therein the details including location of property names dates witnesses and other factual matters all such complaints shall be signed by the complainant such complaints shall be filed within one year after the alleged violation of this division b the city manager may receive hear and determine complaints as provided herein the city manager may adopt rules policies and regulations and involve city staff as the city manager deems appropriate consistent with this division and the laws of the state to carry out the policy and provisions of this division and the powers and duties of the city manager c the city manager may informally recommend solutions to the parties to the complaint to address the situation d a timelyfiled complaint shall be referred immediately to the city attorney  penalty  forfeiture a any person found in violation of this division shall for the first violation forfeit not less than $50000 nor more than $500000 plus the cost of the action b each day upon which a violation occurs shall constitute a separate violation c for each successive violation within five years of having been adjudged to be in violation of this division the person shall forfeit not less than $100000 nor more than $1000000  private actions in addition to the remedies set forth in this division an aggrieved person may commence a civil action in any court of competent jurisdiction to obtain appropriate relief with respect to violations set forth in this division  secs 2411224135  reserved division 3  obstructing or resisting an officer footnotes  3  state law reference for statutory provisions concerning obstructing or resisting an officer see wis stats  94641 as from time to time amended or renumbered generally no person shall knowingly resist or obstruct an officer while such officer is doing any act in an official capacity and with lawful authority  definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning obstructs means and includes without limitation knowingly giving false information to the officer or knowingly placing physical evidence with intent to mislead the officer in the performance of his or her duty including the service of any summons or civil process officer means a peace officer or other public officer or public employee having the authority by virtue of the officers or employees office or employment to take another into custody  violations  penalties a any person who violates any provision set forth in this division shall forfeit and pay to the city a forfeiture of not less than $5000 and no more than $100000 b to each such forfeiture the court shall add and impose against the violator all customary court costs fees penalties and assessments c upon default in payment of an imposed forfeiture and costs such convicted person may be imprisoned for not more than 60 days in the rock county jail andor the court may impose other penalties and remedies as otherwise provided by law  secs 2413924160  reserved division 4  disorderly houses footnotes  4  state law reference for statutory provisions concerning keeping a place of prostitution see wis stats  94434 and 94435 violation  penalty any person convicted of violating this division shall forfeit and pay to the city a penalty of not to exceed $5000 together with the costs of prosecution for each offense and in default of the payment of the fine or forfeiture shall be imprisoned in the county jail not more than 30 days in all cases each days continuance of any violation constitutes a separate offense prior 11part   secs 2416224190  reserved division 5  gambling footnotes  5  state law reference for statutory provisions concerning gambling see wis stats ch 945 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning gambling device may be a gambling machine or in addition playing cards or dice or similar articles when the same are used in making a bet or playing a game or contest for money or other similar prize or award or for merchandise devices including but not limited to amusement devices which test skill and which do not solely rely on chance some of which are referred to andor known as redemption games are exempt from the provisions of this division video poker video blackjack and similar video games of chance shall not be considered redemption games or devices nor games contests events or tests of skill gambling machine 1 a gambling machine is a contrivance which for a consideration affords the player an opportunity to obtain something of value the award of which is determined by chance even though accompanied by some skill and whether or not the prize is automatically paid by the machine video poker video blackjack and similar video games of chance are included within this definition 2 the term gambling machine does not include any of the following a a device used in conducting a bingo occasion or raffle under wis stats ch 563 used in conducting a lottery under wis stats ch 565 or used in conducting a race under wis stats ch 562 b any amusement device if it rewards the player exclusively with one or more nonredeemable free replays for achieving certain scores and does not change the ratio or record the number of the free replays so awarded c an amusement device involving skill if it rewards the player exclusively with merchandise contained within the amusement device proper and limited to prizes toys and novelties each having a wholesale value which is not more than seven times the cost charged to play the amusement device once or $500 whichever is less in this subdivision the term skill means within an opportunity provided for all players fairly to obtain prizes or rewards of merchandise a players precision dexterity or ability to use his or her knowledge which enables him or her to obtain more frequent rewards or prizes than does another less precise dexterous or knowledgeable player gambling place 1 the term gambling place means any building or tent or vehicle whether selfpropelled or not or any room within any of them one of whose uses is any of the following making and settling bets  receiving holding recording or forwarding bets or offers to bet  conducting lotteries  playing gambling machines or using gambling machines or devices for money merchandise or a prize of some kind or description 2 the term gambling place does not include a place where bingo or a raffle is conducted under wis stats ch 563 where a lottery is conducted under wis stats ch 565 or where a race is conducted under wis stats ch 562 and does not include a gambling vessel that is in the process of construction delivery conversion or repair by a shipbuilding business that complies with wis stats   3 evidence that the place has a general reputation as a gambling place or that at or about the time in question it was frequently visited by persons known to be professional gamblers or known as frequenters of gambling places is admissible on the issue of whether it is a gambling place 4 any gambling place is a public nuisance and may be proceeded against under wis stats ch 823 lottery 1 the term lottery is an enterprise wherein for a consideration the participants are given an opportunity to win a prize the award of which is determined by chance even though accompanied by some skill the term consideration as used in this subsection means anything which is a commercial or financial advantage to the promoter or a disadvantage to any participant 2 the term lottery does not include bingo or a raffle conducted under wis stats ch 563 a savings promotion program under wis stats     or  or a program sponsored by a federally chartered financial institution or in which a federally chartered financial institution participates that meets all requirements for a savings promotion program under wis stats     or  parimutuel wagering conducted under wis stats ch 562 or the state lottery or any multijurisdictional lottery conducted under wis stats ch 565 3 a in this subsection the term consideration means anything which is a commercial or financial advantage to the promoter or a disadvantage to any participant but does not include any advantage to the promoter or disadvantage to any participant caused when any participant learns from newspapers magazines and other periodicals radio or television where to send the participants name and address to the promoter b in any game drawing contest sweepstakes or other promotion none of the following constitutes consideration under this subsection 1 listening to or watching a television or radio program 2 filling out a coupon or entry form that is received mail or published in a newspaper or magazine if facsimiles of the coupon or entry form or handwritten and other informal entries are acceptable or if no purchase is required 3 furnishing proof of purchase if the proof required does not consist of more than the container of any product as packaged by the manufacturer or a part of the container or a facsimile of either 4 sending the coupon or entry form and proof of purchase by mail to a designated address 5 filling out a coupon or entry form obtained and deposited on the premises of a bona fide trade fair or trade show defined as an exhibition by five or more competitors of goods wares or merchandise at a location other than a retail establishment or shopping center or other place where goods and services are customarily sold  but if an admission fee is charged to the exhibition all facilities for obtaining and depositing coupons or entry forms shall be outside the area for which an admission fee is required 6 visiting a mercantile establishment or other place without being required to make a purchase or pay an admittance fee 7 using a chance promotion exempt under wis stats  100162 8 an employee referring a person to the employees employer to purchase goods or services from the employer or identifying for the employer a person who may purchase goods or services from the employer regardless of whether the employee who makes the referral or identification is compensated in any manner for the referral or identification 9 a deposit of an amount of money in an account that results in an entry in a savings promotion program under wis stats     or  or a program sponsored by a federally chartered financial institution or in which a federally chartered financial institution participates that meets all requirements for a savings promotion program under wis stats     or  prior 02   prohibitiongambling places devices and lotteries no person shall keep establish or maintain any gambling place or keep or use any article machine or device for gambling purposes or permit any person to gamble bet or play for money or gain with or by means of any article or device or machine in any room or place under his or her control  nor shall any person conduct a lottery or permit a lottery to be conducted on his or her premises or any premises under his or her control prior 03   prohibitionexceptions a no person shall participate in any lottery game of chance dice game or similar game or play any gambling machine or gambling device or make any bet on any contest or participate in any game of chance or game played for money or merchandise or other prize except for prizes such as medals ribbons trophies and the like b the regulation in a of this section shall not prohibit professional athletes or other performers from being paid for playing or performing c the regulation in a of this section shall not prohibit the possession or use of games contests amusement devices or other devices of skill including but not limited to redemption games redemption devices and similar devices primarily involving skill video poker video blackjack and similar video games of chance shall not be considered redemption games or redemption devices nor games contests events or tests of skill prior 04   seizure of prohibited items by police the chief of police and all police officers of the city are authorized and required to seize and hold all such articles and devices as shown in title found by them and report thereon and dispose of the same in accordance with the direction of the court prior 05   violation  penalty any person convicted of violating this division shall forfeit and pay to the city a penalty of not to exceed $5000 together with the costs of prosecution for each offense and in default of the payment of the fine or forfeiture shall be imprisoned in the county jail not more than 30 days in all cases each days continuance of any violation constitutes a separate offense prior 11part   secs 2419624213  reserved division 6  indecent exposure public nudity footnotes  6  state law reference for statutory provisions concerning lewd and lascivious behavior see wis stats  94420 intent  definitions a the health welfare peace tranquility safety good order police power legitimate governmental interest intent goals and content neutral objectives of the city council as set forth in as from time to time amended or renumbered are hereby reiterated adopted and incorporated herein by reference as if fully set forth verbatim b unless specifically defined or used differently in this division the terms set forth and defined in as from time to time amended or renumbered are hereby reiterated adopted and incorporated herein by reference as if fully set forth verbatim c public place 1 the term public place means upon any public property owned by or open to the general public such as a public park beach playground school ground street highway sidewalk alley greenbelt and other public place held open to the general public and all buildings and enclosed places thereon and whether or not an admission or other fee is charged levied or collected  and private property only if the exposure or prohibited activity is occurring without the consent of the property owner or possessor 2 exempt from the application of this division are private motel hotel and boardinghouse sleep rooms private residences and other places of private abode  and mothers breastfeeding their children  prohibition no person in a public place as defined herein may intentionally or knowingly engage in the actual 1 showing or revealing of a human bare buttock anus perineum anal region anal or natal cleft or cleavage pubic area male genitals testicle female genitals vulva or female nipple female areola whether or not in a state of sexual stimulation or arousal with less than a fully opaque covering  2 showing or revealing of human male genitals in a discernibly erect or turgid state even if completely and opaquely covered  or 3 act of masturbation sexual intercourse sodomy bestiality necrophilia sadomasochistic abuse fellatio or cunnilingus  violation  penalty a any person who violates any of the provisions of this division shall forfeit and pay to the city a a separate offense c in default of the payment of such forfeiture such person shall be subject to the remedies vested in the court for such nonpayment d in addition to and not in lieu of the penalties and remedies set forth in this division the city may seek obtain and enforce one andor more forms of injunctive and other equitable andor legal relief against the offender for said violation  secs 2421724240  reserved division 7  spitting prohibition when no person shall spit or expectorate upon any sidewalk or other public walk or upon the floor or other portion of the interior of any theater hall or public building prior 15   violation  penalty any person who violates any of the provisions of this division shall pay to the city a forfeiture of not less than $2500 and not exceeding $50000 together with the costs of prosecution for each offense and each day during which any such violation continues shall be deemed a separate offense in default of the payment of such penalty the violator shall be imprisoned in the county jail not less than five days nor to exceed 60 days prior 22   secs 2424324262  reserved division 8  drug houses and criminal gang houses prostitution houses and gambling houses prohibited declaration of policy a the city council hereby find that the protection of the peace comfort security safety order tranquility and decency of the citys neighborhoods residences and property and the enforcement of criminal laws and city ordinances pertaining thereto are of utmost priority the best interest of the community and of benefit to the citys residents peaceful safe and orderly neighborhoods are fostered by the continued cooperation by and amongst the city its residents and citizens b the city council hereby find that the existence of drug houses criminal gang houses prostitution houses and gambling houses adversely affect neighborhoods harm the residents thereof harm the city as a whole destroy the peace safety tranquility and good order of the neighborhood in which such houses are present and the city overall directly lead to the physical and good order deterioration of such neighborhoods constitute public nuisances and need to be controlled andor eliminated in the manner provided by state statutes c in order to better facilitate such ongoing cooperation and the mutual health welfare peace safety order and tranquility goals shared by the city council the citys residents property owners property possessors and neighborhoods the city council hereby find that the city requires additional procedures remedies and relief for such public nuisances than that currently set forth in this find certain state statutes of benefit and applicable hereto and hereby expressly adopt an ordinance in furtherance of the abovestated legitimate goals public interests and community desires  drug houses and criminal gang houses prohibited no person may directly or indirectly own have any legal or equitable interest in possess manage maintain conduct use habitate permit have a legal or equitable interest in permit andor invite or attempt to invite others to visit any building structure improvement real property andor personal property which is used as andor a part of a drug house criminal gang house prostitution house gambling house dilapidated house or other public nuisance as those terms are defined and used in wis stats ch 823 including but not limited to wis stats   et seq as from time to time amended renumbered or modified  definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning criminal gang house drug house prostitution house gambling house other public nuisance controlled substance controlled substance analog and the other words terms and phrases used in this division unless a different definition or use is expressly provided in this division shall be defined and have the meaning set forth in wis stats ch 823 as from time to time amended renumbered or modified including but not limited to wis stats   et seq pertaining to drug houses and criminal gang houses person means each and every legal and equitable owner lessor lessee possessor manager tenant occupier guest invitee receiver and other natural person firm corporation partnership limited liability company limited liability partnership joint venture or any other entity of whatsoever kind or nature  state law adopted a the provisions of wis stats ch 823 as from time to time amended renumbered or modified including but not limited to wis stats   et seq pertaining to drug houses and criminal gang houses are hereby incorporated by reference into this division as if fully set forth verbatim herein b each and every act prohibited and each and every definition right remedy relief forfeiture and procedure set forth in such wisconsin statutes are prohibited andor incorporated as applicable by this division  concurrent and separate jurisdiction authorization and procedures the city may proceed concomitantly or separately under this division andor directly under the applicable wisconsin statutes notwithstanding this division the city may proceed directly under one or more provisions of the applicable wisconsin statutes without the necessity to commence any action or otherwise proceed under this division the city may commence and prosecute violation of this division in order to recover the relief andor penalties set forth in this division  municipal officials authorized to take action each and every city elected and appointed official officer employee and duly authorized representative or agent may take such action from time to time as he or she deems necessary appropriate andor desirable to effectuate the intent and purpose of this division andor the applicable state statute including but not limited to the commencement enforcement and prosecution of actions for violation of this division or any of its provisions against any person andor property such enforcement and prosecution may be on behalf of the city in the name of the city council and without the need for any prior or other authorization by the city council  liberal construction the provisions of this division shall be liberally construed in order to promote and effectuate the purposes intent and provisions contained herein  cumulative and not exclusive effect of remedies relief or penalties this division is cumulative in its legal affect and is not in lieu of or exclusive of any and all other legal and equitable rights or remedies under this division other city ordinances state statutes state administrative codes or common law the election to use or seek the relief remedies forfeiture damage andor penalties under one or more procedures does not waive or estop and does not act as a waiver or estoppel of the city from concurrently or separately seeking andor obtaining other relief remedies forfeiture damage andor penalties under one or more other provisions of this division other city ordinance state statutes state administrative codes or common law  severability the provisions of this chapter are severable and if any provision sentence clause section or part thereof is held illegal invalid unconstitutional andor inapplicable to any person or circumstance such illegality invalidity unconstitutionality or inapplicability shall not affect or impair any of the remaining provisions sentences clauses sections or parts of this chapter or their application to or enforceability against any other person or circumstance such remaining provisions sentences clauses sections and parts of this chapter shall remain in full force and effect such being the express intent of the city council  violations  penalties  remedies  injunctive and other relief the following penalties remedies and relief for violations of any provision of this division are cumulative and not exclusive may be jointly and severally sought by the city and may be ordered andor imposed as applicable by the courts 1 any person who violates or causes to be violated any provision of this division shall upon conviction thereof pay a forfeiture of not less than $10000 nor more than $1000000 for each violation together with the costs of prosecution in default of payment thereof such person shall be subject to such remedies for nonpayment from time to time as is provided in law andor equity including but not limited to commitment in the rock county jail for not less than one day nor more than 60 days for each violation the monetary forfeiture set forth in this subsection may be but need not be prosecuted and sought by the city in addition to and not necessary in lieu of any concomitant andor separate action to effectuate the forfeiture of the property to the city under this division andor applicable state statutes the city may seek and the court may impose varying amounts of monetary forfeiture based on the number of previous violations the severity of the various incident and the particular facts and circumstances pertaining to each incident andor action 2 each and every day that a violation occurs continues andor remains present constitutes a separate offense 3 the city in addition to the above monetary penalty may from time to time seek and obtain and the court may order temporary andor permanent injunctive relief abatement and such other legal andor equitable relief remedies judgments andor orders of the court against any person andor property as the court may from time to time deem necessary appropriate andor desirable to effectuate the intent of this division and the public good peace order welfare andor safety including but not limited to forfeiture of the property to the city under this division andor the applicable state statutes 4 in addition to the above penalties relief and remedies the city council may suspend revoke andor nonrenew any license andor permit pertaining to such property after conducting a public hearing thereon 5 in addition to the above penalties relief and remedies upon a conviction of a violation of any provision of this division the court may suspend revoke andor nonrenew any license andor permit pertaining to such property 6 it shall be the responsibility of the convicted person to immediately abate each and every violation upon the property as expeditiously as possible unless otherwise directed by the city or the court 7 this division is cumulative in its legal affect and is not in lieu of any and all other legal and equitable remedies under city ordinances state statutes state administrative codes and common law including but not limited to forfeiture of the property to the city under this division andor the applicable state statutes 8 in addition to the above monetary forfeitures and not in lieu thereof the city may at its sole discretion proceed under one or more sections andor provisions of wis stats ch 823 including but not limited to wis stats   et seq andor this division pertaining to drug houses or criminal gang houses in seeking and obtaining the court permitted andor ordered confiscation forfeiture sale of real andor personal property and such other legal and equitable relief as permitted under such applicable state laws as from time to time amended renumbered or modified 9 to the extent permitted by applicable state law as from time to time amended renumbered andor modified the costs of the remedies and relief obtained andor incurred by the city under this division state statutes andor administrative codes may be billed against the owner of the property and if not paid assessed as a special charge with a lien placed against the property until paid in full with interest thereon  secs 2427324292  reserved division 9  chronic nuisance premises definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning chief means the chief of police or his or her designee enforcement action means arrest the issuance of a citation the issuance of a written warning issuance of a documented verbal warning or the issuance of an order to correct an arrest would count as the enforcement action if the original offense occurred at the premises and the arrestee is arrested later at another location jgo means janesville general ordinances neighborhood and community services director means the neighborhood and community services director or his or her designee nuisance activity means any of the following activities behaviors or conduct occurring upon a premises 1 police nuisance activity a an act of harassment as defined in wis stats   b disorderly conduct as defined in wis stats  94701 c battery substantial battery or aggravated battery as defined in wis stats  94019 d lewd and lascivious behavior as defined in wis stats  94420 e prostitution as defined in wis stats  94430 f theft as defined in wis stats  94320 g receiving stolen property as defined in wis stats  94334 h arson as defined in wis stats  94302 i possession manufacture or delivery of a controlled substance or related offenses as defined in wis stats ch 961 j gambling as defined in wis stats  94502 k trespassing as defined in wis stats  94313 and 94314 l homicide as defined in wis stats  94001 m recklessly endangering safety as defined in wis stats  94130 n prohibited possession of a firearm as defined in wis stats  94129 o carrying a concealed weapon as defined in wis stats  94123 p probation or parole violations as defined in wis stats   q human trafficking as defined in wis stats   r exposure andor public urination as defined in division 6 of this chapter v drug houses and criminal gang houses prostitution houses and gambling houses as defined in division 8 of this chapter w chapter bb property offenses as defined in division 4 of this chapter cc weapons offenses as defined in division 2 of of this chapter dd firearms offense as defined in division 3 of of this chapter ee to underage persons activities as defined in ii any conspiracy to commit as defined in wis stats  93931 or attempt to commit as defined in wis stats  93932 any of the criminal activities behaviors or
