3440934429  reserved article xv  railroads and railroad crossings footnotes  6  state law reference safety devices at railroad crossings generally wis stats  19526 signal lights no locomotive engine train or car shall be driven along any track of any railroad in the nighttime without having upon the advancing end of the same a conspicuous light  running backward  requirements no locomotive engine or train shall be driven backward and no detached car or cars shall be run upon any track of any such railroad without having stationed upon the advancing end of the same a person whose duty it shall be to keep a lookout ahead and give warning of the approach of the same to all persons who otherwise might be endangered thereby and to stop such engine train or car when necessary to avert danger and also to give a danger signal to the locomotive engineer in cases where the car upon which such man is stationed is attached to an engine  whistle warning the engine whistle shall not be sounded except as a warning to avert danger or when approaching crossings  planking or paving at street crossings a at crossings of streets at grade by railway company tracks where the street which is crossed is not paved in any manner the railway company shall cover the whole surface of its rightofway to the width of the traveled portion of the street either with planking not less than three inches in thickness or with suitable paving where the street which is crossed by the railway is paved the railway shall cover the whole surface of its rightofway to the width of the paved or surfaced portion of the street so crossed with paving or surfacing comparable to the paving or surfacing on the street so crossed the railway shall maintain such planking paving or surfacing in good condition the upper surface of such planking paving or surfacing shall be on the level with the tops of the adjacent rails of the track or tracks of such railway company b in cases in which a railway track parallels or runs along a sidewalk so that any portion of the railway rightofway is lower than the sidewalk grade and lies within two feet of the nearest edge of the sidewalk the railway shall comply with the requirements of this section by filling the excavation with a suitable paving to the level of the adjacent sidewalk from the nearest edge of the sidewalk to the nearest rail  spur tracks in streets no person or corporation shall lay any ties or rails for the purposes of a branch spur switch or sidetrack of a railroad within the limits of any street without the consent of the city engineer any person or corporation desiring to construct any such track within the limits of any street shall before commencing the construction of the same petition the city engineer for permission to do so and shall file with such petition a map showing the proposed location of such track and in such petition state the purpose for which it is desired to use such track and the manner in which it is proposed to construct the same  electric danger signals  flagperson at crossings every railroad shall establish and maintain electric danger or warning signals at all places ordered by the public service commission and of a type ordered by such commission and shall maintain flagperson or other type of protection at such times and places as shall be ordered by such commission and shall take all steps necessary to make all crossings of highways by railroads safe no such warning sign shall be placed in any portion of the traveled highway  railway engines and cars stopped in streets unlawful a it is unlawful to stop any railroad train locomotive or railroad car upon or across any highway or street crossing or to cause obstruction of vehicular traffic on public streets at street crossings by stopping leaving standing switching or otherwise maintaining constant railway use at such crossing longer than five continuous minutes or for more than seven minutes out of any 12 continuous minutes b any conductor engineer switchperson brakeman or other employee or agent in charge of such offending railroad locomotive or car or otherwise responsible therefor who violates the provisions of this section shall pay the city a forfeiture of not less than $10000 nor more than $50000 for each such violation plus the costs of prosecution and in default of payment shall be imprisoned not less than five days nor more than 15 days in the county jail a violation for each 12minute period constitutes a separate offense    1981 violation  penalty any railroad company which fails to comply with the requirements of this article shall forfeit and pay to the city a penalty of not to exceed $10000 for each such failure or violation together with the costs of prosecution and each days continuance of such failure or violation constitutes a separate offense any other person who violates any of the provisions of this article shall forfeit and pay to the city a penalty of not to exceed $10000 for each such violation together with the costs of prosecution and in default of payment shall be imprisoned not to exceed 30 days is excluded from the provisions of this penalty  secs 3443834457  reserved article xvi  financial gains on public property not allowed financial gain on public property not allowed  exceptions a unless otherwise specifically allowed by some other provision of these ordinances no person firm corporation society or organization shall use any public property public park park facility bathing beach playground greenbelt or open space for the purpose of financial gain return or any types or business or financial activity b exempted from the provisions of this article are those organizations and activities which have been granted specific permission by the city council or the recreation director in the manner set forth in this article those concessions operating under the authority of the park division and those activities conducted within the janesville ice arena golf courses and tennis facilities which have the permission of the city council c the use or closure of any public street alley sidewalk or other public right of way is subject to the approval permit and other requirements of the chief of police as set forth in of this chapter  financial gain  definition the term financial gain for the purposes of this article includes but is not limited to events or activities at which any type of concession or sales occur a registration fee is charged an admission fee is paid or donations are solicited  permission request procedure a applicants requesting permission to use public property for financial gain shall complete and file a written application and require supporting documents with the recreation director in such form content and manner as the recreation director may from time to time prescribe b the recreation director or his or her designee may grant or deny financial gain permission under this article without the necessity of further city council review action or approval to those persons firms corporations societies organizations and activities who currently satisfy each and every requirement set forth in this article any application denied by the recreation director may be appealed to the city council c the city council may affirm amend or modify any application denial decision by the recreation director and may withdraw permission andor revoke any issued permit at any time and without cause though cause may include but is not limited to violation of this section any other ordinance or law or any order of the chief of police recreation director fire chief city manager public works director or their representatives  indemnification requirement applicants shall fully and completely indemnify and hold the city harmless from any and all liability of whatever kind and nature for any and all personal injury death and property damage directly and indirectly arising from such use  insurancebond requirement the recreation director may require a policy of insurance bond or other surety naming the city as the insured in an amount established from time to time by the recreation director and with regard to the particular location circumstances and activities proposed  responsibilities  applicant an applicant who is issued a permit allowing him or her to use public property public park park facility bathing beach playground greenbelt or open space for the purpose of financial gain shall 1 at all times maintain adequate sufficient and properly operating warning signs lights barricades fences and other warning and public safety devices trash receptacles and such other warning and safety devices as may be required by the chief of police city manager director of public works fire chief or any of their representatives 2 take all precautions necessary to make the public property affected safe for all users 3 take all precautions necessary to make the public property affected safe for all abutting and nearby property owners and possessors 4 not later than the expiration date and time of the permit remove all litter rubbish trash garbage and refuse clean clear and make sightly the entire closure and all abutting private and public property affected by the applicants activities and return the property in the same or better condition than that in which it was at the time of closure 5 immediately cease all use and remove any and all obstructions as soon as the need for such obstruction ceases but not later than the expiration date and time of the permit 6 immediately and fully comply with any and all written and oral order of the chief of police city manager fire chief recreation director director of public works or their representatives  violation  penalty any person who violates any provision of this article shall pay to the city a forfeiture of not less than $5000 nor more than $100000 together with the costs of prosecution for each offense and each day during which any violation continues shall be deemed a separate and additional offense in default of the payment of such penalty the violator shall be imprisoned in the county jail for not less than one day nor more than 30 days for each offense  secs 3446534481  reserved article xvii  public waters rock riverboundaries a for the purpose of this article the boundaries of rock river which lie between the  rock riverconstruction and refuse unlawful when no person shall drive any piles lay any foundation construct any wall or build or maintain any building platform or other structure in or over any part of rock river without the permission of the council no person shall place or deposit in said river any earth stone ashes paper boxes tin cans glass products broken glass oil or petroleum products brush refuse rubbish or other substance whatsoever tending to pollute said river or to obstruct its flow or to render the same unsightly or unsafe  rock riversanitary regulations no person shall erect or maintain any privy on the bank or over rock river or any headrace connected therewith or drain any sanitary sewer in said river in such manner that filth from such privy or sewage from such sanitary sewer shall fall flow or drain into said river at any place within the city limits no person shall place or deposit in rock river or in any headrace connecting therewith any carcass carrion offal or other substance which is or is likely to become unwholesome or offensive  penalty any person who violates any of the provisions of shall forfeit and pay to the city a penalty of not to exceed $50000 for each offense together with the costs of prosecution and in default of the payment of such penalty shall be imprisoned not to exceed 90 days  rock river and lions beach lakeregulation applicability the provisions of shall apply to that part of rock river which is within the city limits and to lions beach lake  rock river and lions beach lakestate boating and water safety laws adopted the statutory provisions describing and defining regulations with respect to water traffic boats boating and related water activities in the following enumerated sections of the wisconsin statutes exclusive of any provisions therein relating to the penalties to be imposed or the punishment for violation of said statutes are adopted and by reference made a part of this section as if fully set forth herein any act required to be performed or prohibited by the provision of any statute incorporated by reference herein is required or prohibited by this section 1 wis stats  3050definitions 2 wis stats  3051operation of unnumbered boats prohibited  exemptions 3 wis stats  3053identification number to be displayed on boat  certificate to be carried 4 wis stats  3060classification of motorboats 5 wis stats  3061lighting equipment 6 wis stats  3062other equipment 7 wis stats  3064patrol boats exempt from certain traffic regulations 8 wis stats  3065traffic rules 9 wis stats  3066speed restrictions paragraph 1 only adopted 10 wis stats  3067accidents and accident reports paragraphs 1 and 3aonly 11 wis stats  3068prohibited operation 12 wis stats  3069water skiing 13 wis stats  3071boats equipped with toilets 14 wis stats  3076deposit of money to obtain release from arrest  penalty a any person convicted of violating any provision adopted by reference in which is described in either wis stats  3067l or 3068l shall be fined not more than $20000 or imprisoned not more than 60 days unless the fine is paid sooner b any person convicted of violating any other provision of shall be fined not more than $5000 for the first offense or not more than $10000 on conviction of the same offense a second or subsequent time within one year in case such fine is not paid the person convicted may be imprisoned not more than 30 days in case of the first offense and 90 days in case of the second offense unless in each instance the fine is paid sooner  subdivisions footnotes  1  state law reference authority of city to adopt ordinances governing the subdivision or other division of land wis stats  23645 article i  in general purpose the purpose of this chapter is to promote the public health safety and general welfare of the community the regulations in this chapter are designed to lessen congestion in the streets and highways  to further the orderly layout and use of land  to secure safety from fire panic and other dangers  to provide adequate light and air  to prevent the overcrowding of land  to avoid undue concentration of population  to facilitate adequate provision for transportation water sewerage schools parks playgrounds and other public requirements  and to facilitate the further resubdivision of larger tracts into smaller parcels of land these regulations are made with reasonable consideration among other things of the character of the city with a view of conserving the value of the buildings placed upon land providing the best possible environment for human habitation and for encouraging the most appropriate use of land throughout the city prior 01   scope a any division of land within the city or its extraterritorial plat approval jurisdiction shall be surveyed and a plat or certified survey thereof approved and recorded as required by this chapter and wis stats ch 236 b the provisions of this chapter shall not apply to the following 1 transfers of interests in land by will or pursuant to court order  2 leases for a term not to exceed ten years mortgages or easements  3 the sale or exchange of parcels of land between owners of adjoining property if the parcel transferred is less than 50 feet wide at the building setback line and if the resulting lots are not reduced below the minimum sizes of new lots required by this chapter or other applicable laws or ordinances prior 02     1974 general requirements a no person firm or corporation shall divide any land located within the city limits or within the extraterritorial plat approval jurisdiction of the city which shall result in a subdivision or certified survey as defined in this chapter without complying with the provisions of wis stats ch 236 and the requirements of this chapter b the proposed subdivision or certified survey shall take into consideration the following 1 all applicable ordinances of the city and of governing jurisdictions  2 the master plans of the city and area and such plans as the city planner may be preparing for the plan commission  3 the official map of the city and the adopted janesville area long range transportation plan as amended from time to time  4 the rules of the state board of health relating to lot size and lot elevation if the subdivision is not served by a public sewer and provision for such service has not been made  5 the rules of the state highway commission relating to safety of access and the preservation of the public interest and investment in the streets in the subdivision or any lot contained therein abutting on a state trunk highway or connecting street  6 whenever a parcel to be platted or divided by certified survey embraces any part of a street highway or greenbelt designated in the master plan or official map such part of such proposed public way shall be dedicated by the subdivider in the location and at a width indicated in the approved janesville area long range transportation plan or the master neighborhood plan  secs 3643624  reserved article ii  definitions alley alley means a strip of land dedicated to public use primarily to provide vehicular service access to the side or rear properties otherwise abutting on a street prior 041   certified survey certified survey means a map intending to create parcels of land or building sites in any area zoned residence district not more than four parcels may be created by certified survey in any fiveyear period from the same lot parcel or tract of land prior 042     1974 city datum city datum means elevations relative to monument at east court street and south main street which is elevation 10000 and 77658 feet above sea level sandy hook datum prior 043   commission commission means the city plan commission established in accordance with wis stats  6223 prior 044   culdesac culdesac means a local street with only one outlet and having an appropriate terminal for the safe and convenient reversal of traffic movement prior 045   easement easement means a grant by the owner of the use of land by the public corporations or persons for specific uses and purposes prior 046   easement scenic scenic easement means a public easement for the purpose of preserving natural scenicbeauty by restricting construction prior 047   easement utility utility easement means a public easement for the purpose of locating utilities such as electricity telephone gas water service cable tv and the right to maintain such prior 048   extraterritorial plat jurisdiction extraterritorial plat jurisdiction means the unincorporated area within three miles of the city limits but does not include any area in which the city council has specifically waived its right to approve plats and has filed with the register of deeds a map or legal description describing the area in which approval is waived prior 049     1981 floodplain floodplain means the land adjacent to a body of water which has been or may be covered by floodwaters prior 0410   frontage road frontage road means a road auxiliary to and located parallel to an arterial street for control of access and for service to abutting properties prior 0411   greenbelt greenbelt means an open area of land the primary purpose of which is to carry storm sewer on the ground surface in lieu of an enclosed storm sewer greenbelts may serve multiple purposes including vehicular or pedestrian traffic sanitary sewers water mains storm sewer stormwater or floodwater retention basins park development or other related uses prior 0412   janesville area long range transportation plan janesville area long range transportation plan means the long range transportation plan which encompasses the city and the towns of janesville harmony la prairie and rock  lot lot means an area of land less than 15 acres resulting from the division of a tract of land for the purpose of transfer of ownership prior 0413   lot flag flag lots means a parcel of land which due to unusual conditions cannot meet the requirements for frontage on a dedicated street where such conditions exist the lot may be provided access by way of a stem extending from the main body of the lot to the street said stem shall be a part of the subject lot and not a separate parcel or an easement across adjoining property prior 0414   master plan master plan means the comprehensive plan for guiding and shaping the growth and development of the janesville area including all of its component parts as set forth in the various maps plats charts and written matter adopted and certified by the city council and city plan commission prior 0416   official map official map means the map indicating the location width andor extent of existing and proposed streets highways parkways parks and playgrounds as adopted by the city council pursuant to wis stats  62236 prior 0417   planned development planned development means a development pattern and technique wherein structures are arranged in closely related groups to enable building at higher densities in certain areas while preserving natural features in others a planned development would normally incorporate private common open space areas and give emphasis to the pedestrian as opposed to the automobile in its design prior 0418   preliminary plat preliminary plat means a map showing the salient features of a proposed subdivision or certified survey as described in  submitted to the secretary of the city plan commission for the purposes of preliminary consideration prior to the final plats prior 0419   reserve strip reserve strip means a strip of land reserved mainly for the purpose of controlling access to a public street it is also referred to as a spite strip prior 0420   street street means a public way for pedestrian and vehicular traffic whether designated as a street highway arterial collector road avenue boulevard lane place or however otherwise designated 1 collector streets are those which carry traffic from minor streets to the system of major streets and highways including the principal entrance streets of a residential development and streets for the circulation within such a development and as designated as collectors on the functional classification map in the janesville area long range transportation plan 2 frontage roads are minor streets which are parallel to and adjacent to major streets and highways and which provide access to abutting properties and protection from 3 major streets and highways are those which are used primarily for fast or heavy traffic and are designated as arterials on the functional classification map in the janesville area long range transportation plan 4 minor streets are those which are primarily for access to the abutting properties prior 0421   subdivider subdivider means a person or certified survey or plat prior 0422   subdivision a except as provided in b of this section the term subdivision means a division of a lot parcel or tract of land by the owner thereof or the owners agent for the purpose of sale or of building development and to which any of the following applies 1 the act of division creates five or more parcels or building sites of 1 acres each or less in area 2 five or more parcels or building sites of 1 acres each or less in area are created by successive divisions within a period of five years b the term subdivision does not include a division of land into five or more parcels or building sites by a certified survey map in accordance with an ordinance enacted or a resolution adopted under wis stats  236341ar1 prior 0423     1974 secs 36483667  reserved article iii  preliminary plat preliminary consultationtopographic map a previous to filing a preliminary plat the subdivider should consult with the city planner or secretary of the plan commission for advice or assistance b when requested by the plan commission as being necessary the subdivider must provide a topographic map of the area to be platted with a twofoot contour interval contours shall be referred to the citys established datum as identified by the city engineer  preliminary consultationinformation required the following information shall be provided at the time of or prior to the filing of the preliminary plat 1 information including data on existing covenants information describing the subdivision proposal such as number of residential lots typical lot width and depth business areas playgrounds park areas and other public areas tree or screen planting proposed protective covenants and proposed utilities and street improvements  2 a digitally rendered sketch plan showing the proposed layout of streets lots and other features in relation to existing conditions the sketch must be drawn in the coordinate system approved by the city engineer and submitted on disk or via electronic transfer in a cadd or gis format approved by the city of janesville  water pressure investigation at the time the information required by or 36114 is provided the city planner shall check with the director of public services to determine the water pressure that is available to the area to be included in the plat or certified survey it is desirable that at least 55 pounds per square inch at the main be available for all newly divided areas no preliminary plat or preliminary certified survey of land located in the city shall be approved unless the janesville water utility has the present capability of providing water to all of such area at the main this requirement may be waived by the city plan commission and city council if there is included upon the plat or certified survey a statement to the effect that the janesville water utility cannot supply adequate water pressure to the area covered by the plat or certified survey and that provision for water will have to be done by the individual lot owner    1977 drawing  requirements the preliminary plat shall be submitted as an electronic copy that is capable of clearly legible reproduction not to exceed 36 inches in width and a map scale of not more than 200 feet to the inch where more than one page is used to show the entire area to be platted at the required scale then a single page shall be submitted at any scale that shows the entire area to be platted the preliminary plat shall show correctly on its face the information listed below in this section 1 description a date graphic scale and north point arrow  b the proposed subdivision name which shall not duplicate the name of any plat previously recorded in rock county  c the name and address and telephone number of the owner the subdivider and the surveyors preparing the plat  d location of the proposed subdivision by government lot quarterquarter section section township range and county  e a smallscale drawing of the section or governmental subdivision of the section in which the subdivision lies with the location of the subdivision indicated thereon  f location map showing the relationship between the preliminary plat and surrounding area 2 existing conditions a location and names of adjacent subdivisions and the owners of adjoining parcels of unsubdivided land  b existing land use and zoning on land adjacent to the subdivision  c location width elevations and names of all existing platted streets alleys or other public ways and easements railroad and utility rightsofway parks cemeteries watercourses natural springs drainage ditches permanent buildings bridges and other pertinent data as determined by the plan commission this may include large trees that may have a bearing on the location of the streets  d type and width of any adjacent existing street pavements together with any legally established centerline elevations for streets located outside the city limits  e the water elevations of adjoining bodies of water at the date of the survey and known or determined high and low water elevations and boundaries of the 100year floodfringe floodway andor general floodplain all elevations shall be referred to the citys established datum as identified by the city engineer 3 proposed improvements a the length of the exterior boundaries of the subdivision  b layout and dimensions of an area of all lots proposed lot and block numbers and number of dwelling units if different than number of lots  c note indicating the onsite location and elevation of the plat benchmark referred to in the city established datum as identified by the city engineer  d layout approximate dimensions and names as applicable of all new streets and rightsofway such as alleys highways easements for sewers water mains and other public utilities  e location and approximate dimensions and size of any sites to be reserved or dedicated for schools parks playgrounds greenbelts drainageways or other public use or open space  f location and approximate dimensions and size of any sites reserved for the private use of subdivision or condominium development residents and the conditions and terms of all applicable deed restrictions applying to these sites  g approximate radii of all curves and length of tangents  h contours at vertical intervals of two feet as required by the city engineer  i the boundaries of each phase of platting for the proposed subdivision  preliminary grading and drainage plan the preliminary grading plan shall be submitted as a digital rendering prepared on reproducible paper or film not to exceed 36 inches in width and a map scale of not more than 200 feet to the inch the preliminary grading and drainage plan must include 1 elevation of existing structures existing ground contours andor spot elevations 2 offsite drainage basins that flow plat 3 existing and proposed regional and local flood elevations 4 arrows indicating the direction of proposed overland drainage flow 5 drainage easements as necessary to accommodate the grading plan 6 location and approximate configuration of proposed onsite drainage basins after grading subdivision 7 appropriate stormwater calculations to demonstrate that the facilities identified in 6 of this section are sufficient to meet all requirements of of 8 plats for lands located outside the city of janesville and within the city extraterritorial plat review jurisdiction area are not subject to the requirements above  plat approval procedure a before submitting a final plat for approval the subdivider shall submit nine copies of a preliminary plat to the city planner at least 12 days before the preliminary plat is scheduled to be reviewed by the city plan commission b after review of the preliminary plat and negotiations with the subdivider on changes deemed advisable and the kind and extent of public improvements which will be required the plan commission shall within ten days of its submission approve approve conditionally or reject the plat the subdivider shall be notified in writing of any conditions of approval or the reason for rejection failure by the plan commission to act upon the preliminary plat within 40 days of the submission shall constitute an approval of the preliminary plat c approval of the preliminary plat shall entitle the subdivider to the approval of the layout shown by such plat if the final plat conforms substantially to such layout and conditions of approval have been met prior 052     1974 secs 367436104  reserved article iv  final plats and certified surveys final platwis stats  23620 adopted a final plat of subdivided land shall comply with the requirements of wis stats  23620 which is adopted by reference prior 153a   final platinformation required in addition to the requirements of wis stats  23620 the following information will be required 1 the subdivider shall provide accurate elevations to 010 foot at each lot corner iron monument on street lines elevations shall be referred to the citys established datum as identified by the city of janesville engineering division 2 curve data on plats should include major tangent lengths deflection angles and lengths of chords and arcs for each monument on curved streets where curved lots exceed 100 feet of arc frontage intermediate points are required with said curve data provided for each said intermediate point 3 a table on the plat giving the total acreage number of lot and streets created a breakdown of street centerline lengths and area of public land dedication and list of streets along which sidewalks are to be constructed with an indication of which side if it is intended that sidewalks be installed on only one side of the street 4 master site grading and drainage plan the final plat must include a final master site grading plan which shall contain information as outlined in the master site grading plan handbook on file in the city engineering division the subdivider shall submit a copy of the master site grading and drainage plan to the city as a digital file in a format specified by the city engineer 5 plats and certified survey maps for lands located outside the city of janesville and within the citys extraterritorial plat review jurisdiction area are not subject to the requirements set forth in 4 of this section    1977 final platportion of preliminary plat to be final plat  planner approval if a subdivider wishes to make a final plat of a portion of an approved preliminary plat he or she must first secure the city planners approval of the boundaries of such portion prior 153c   final platcopies and filing fee submitted to city planner  review procedure thirteen copies of the final plat and master site grading and drainage plan including the required filing fee shall be submitted to the city planner at least 12 days before the final plat is scheduled to be reviewed by the city plan commission the applicant shall also submit a copy of the final plat in digital format satisfactory to the city engineer if the final plat is not submitted within 36 months of the last approval of the preliminary plat the plan commission may refuse to approve the final plat prior 053a     1974 final platapproval and rejection procedure the plan commission shall refer the final plat with its recommendation to the city council within 30 days of its submission unless the time is extended by the council the council shall approve or reject the final plat within 60 days of its first submission to the city clerk unless the time is extended by agreement with the subdivider reasons for rejection shall be stated in the minutes of the council meeting and a copy thereof or a written statement of such reasons shall be supplied by the subdivider the city recommends that the subdivider or his or her agent shall forward copies of the plat to the wisconsin department of administration under the option set forth in wis stats  23612 prior 053b   final plattrue copy filed in lieu of original when  approval requirements if the original of the final plat has been filed with another approving authority the subdivider may file a true copy of such plat in lieu of the original however before approval of the council will be inscribed on the original of the final plat the surveyor or the subdivider shall certify the respects in which the original of the final plat differs from the true copy and all modifications must first be approved prior 053c   final platcity to receive digital copy the surveyors at no cost to the city shall provide the city with an electronic copy of the final plat as processed by the wisconsin department of administration upon recording the surveyor shall submit a copy of the final plat in digital format satisfactory to the city engineer  certified surveypurpose all acts of dividing land within the city limits or within the extraterritorial plat jurisdiction must be regulated in the public interest for in no other way can the city hope to ensure a comprehensive and coordinated program of good physical development prior 16part   certified surveyrequirements every division of land that results in a subdivision as defined under this chapter must be done by located within the city if the proposed land division is outside the city limits the preliminary certified survey is submitted to the rock county zoning administrator no final certified survey will be accepted for review which has not been preceded by an approved preliminary certified survey the applicant shall also submit a copy of the preliminary certified survey to the city planner in digital format satisfactory to the city engineer  certified surveypreliminary grading and drainage plan the preliminary grading plan shall be submitted as an electronic copy that is capable of legible this certified survey shall comply with wis stats  23634 b the map shall indicate all existing buildings structures watercourses and drainage facilities and other physical features c the certificate of approval of the secretary of the plan commission or planning director shall be placed on it unless dedication of lands within the city is required then the certificate of the city clerk would be reproduced on the map d the map shall be filed for record with the register of deeds and two copies of such shall be given to the city planning division within 30 days of such recording e the map shall indicate all areas where sidewalks are to be constructed the council or plan commission may approve the certified survey subject to such changes as are deemed necessary f master site grading and drainage plan the final survey must include a final master site grading plan which shall contain information as outlined in the master site grading plan handbook on file in the city engineering division the final master site grading plan must be submitted to the city as a digital file in a format specified by the city engineer g surveys located within the citys extraterritorial plat review jurisdiction area and outside of the city of janesville and are not subject to the requirements of f of this section prior 163     1977 certified surveyutility easement dedications unless adequate provision has already been made in the area by dedication of land for utility easements no certified survey can be approved until an adequate dedication is made for utility easements in the certified survey prior 164   certified surveyapproval or rejection the city plan commission shall within 40 days of the filing of an application under approve approve conditionally or reject the certified survey and notify the applicant of any conditions of approval or reasons for rejection prior 165   certified surveyspecial assessment lands  regulations no person firm or corporation shall divide lands by certified survey or subdivision plat within the city on which special assessments have been levied without first paying such special assessments in full or without first securing an agreement in writing by the parties to the division specifying the division of the assessment and a separate description of the parcels to which the divided portions of the assessment shall apply prior 166   certified surveymap requirements waived when in the case of lot splits or the sale of land between adjoining owners the plan commission may waive the requirements of the certified survey map if it will not be in conflict with the intent of this article in addition in the case of lot splits or the sale of land between adjoining owners the city planner may waive the requirements of the certified survey map if the land being transferred is less than 50 feet wide at the building setback line and if the lots resulting are not reduced below the minimum size of new lots required by this section providing that evidence is given to the city planner that the new lot line has been staked by a registered land surveyor this evidence shall be in the form of either a plat of survey or a print of the area marked to show the new lot line stakes and stamped by the surveyor and such evidence shall be submitted not later than 30 days following the recording of the instrument which transfers the land prior 167     1976 no sales until final plat or certified survey is recorded no subdivider or his or her agent shall offer or contract to convey or convey any subdivision as defined in this article or lot or parcel which lies in a subdivision as defined in this title or lot or parcel regulated by knowing that the final plat thereof or certified survey thereof has not been recorded  except that where the preliminary or final plat of the subdivision or certified survey has been filed for approval with the city an offer or contract to convey may be made if that offer or contract states on its face that it is contingent upon approval of the final plat such offer or contract shall be void if such plat is not approved prior 17   fees subdividers shall pay all fees in amounts as established by the city council from time to time and as set out in the fee schedule that appears in this  special assessment split fee for administrative work to analyze and assign existing assessments to the new parcels based upon the proposed land division including but not limited to complication by many factors including remainder parcels resurveying of previously certified parcels overlap or other factors the city of janesville will charge a minimum fee based on staff time required to fulfill such requests the fee shall be in an amount as established by the city council from time to time and as set out in the fee schedule that appears in this  secs 3612536146  reserved article v  alleys business and industrial districts  requirements  exceptions alleys shall be provided in all business and industrial districts except that the plan commission may waive this requirement where other definite and assured provision is made for fire protection and refuse disposal routes and other service access such as offstreet loading and parking consistent with and adequate for the uses proposed prior 081   residential areas alleys shall not be approved in residential areas unless necessary because of topography or other exceptional circumstances prior 082   width requirement the width of alleys shall be not less than 30 feet prior 083   secs 3615036166  reserved article vi  blocks regulations generally the lengths widths and shapes of blocks shall be such as are appropriate for the locality and the type of development contemplated but block lengths in residential areas shall not exceed 1500 feet nor be less than 600 feet between street lines unless special approval is given for variations by the plan commission prior 101   pedestrian walkways required when pedestrian walkways not less than ten feet wide with a fivefoot pavement may be required by the plan commission center of blocks more than 900 feet long where it is deemed essential a note shall be placed upon the final plat stating that such pedestrian walkway shall be constructed and maintained entirely by the adjacent property owners prior 102   size determination in general the following things should be taken into consideration in determining the size of a block 1 the planned use of the land should be taken into consideration business and industrial uses require different sized blocks and lots than do residential areas 2 need for convenient access circulation control and safety of street traffic should be taken into consideration whenever practicable blocks along arterial and collector streets should not be less than 1000 feet long 3 limitations and advantages of topography should be taken into consideration prior 103   secs 3617036191  reserved article vii  easements requirements generally easements shall be provided and dedicated for installation of utilities and drainageways and when in the public interest scenic easements may be required generally a tenfoot utility easement is required off of the rear lot line and eight feet off of the side lot line utility easements shall be noted along with the required dimensions upon the final plat or certified survey map prior 091   underground utilities all facilities for distribution of electricity excluding lines of 12000 volts or more telephone utility service in residential subdivisions cable television service installed within a newly platted area mobile home parks cluster development or planned development districts shall be placed underground unless the newly created lots or units are served by preexisting systems prior 092   watercourses where a subdivision is traversed by a watercourse drainageway floodplain channel or stream there shall be provided a stormwater easement or rightofway conforming substantially with the line of such watercourse drainageway floodplain channel or stream and adequate for the purpose in the judgment of the city plan commission prior 12   secs 3619536211  reserved article viii  lots requirements generally the size shape and orientation of lots shall be appropriate for the location of the subdivision and for the type of development and use contemplated prior 111   dimensions a residence shall have a minimum width of 70 feet at the building line a minimum depth of 100 feet and a minimum area of 7700 square feet feet in width may be allowed in locations where in the judgment of the plan commission such narrower lots are deemed advisable however no building permit shall be issued for any building which will be used primarily for residential purposes on any lot whose size was reduced below the above criteria after  b residential lots to be served by private sewerage disposal facilities shall comply with the rules of the appropriate state and county agencies c depth and width of properties reserved or laid out for business and industrial purposes shall be adequate to provide for the offstreet service and parking facilities required by this d residential lots fronting on major streets and highways should be platted with extra depth to permit generous distances between the building and such traffic ways e excessive depth in relation to width shall be avoided a proportion of 2 to one shall be considered as a desirable maximum for a width of 70 feet or more prior 112     1976   1977 corner lots corner lots shall be made large enough so that setback lines thereon can fully conform with the setback lines regularly established for the plat thus precluding the necessity of encroaching beyond the normal setbacks notwithstanding any variations permitted by applicable zoning ordinances prior 113   public street access every lot shall front or abut on a public street prior 114   arrangement be so arranged that side lines abutting rear lines or other lots shall be avoided wherever possible especially in residential areas prior 115   side lot lines side lot lines shall be substantially at right angles or radial to street lines prior 116   size  resubdivision when in case a tract is subdivided into parcels containing one or more acres such parcels shall be arranged to allow the resubdivision of any parcels into normal lots in accordance with the provisions of this article prior 117   municipal boundaries follow municipal boundary lines and shall not cross them prior 118   double frontage double frontage on parallel streets shall be avoided except where necessary to provide separation of residential development from traffic arteries or to overcome specific disadvantages of topography and orientation prior 119   flag lots flag lots shall not be allowed unless in the opinion of the plan commission there is no other reasonable alternative the stem of any flag lot shall be a minimum width of 30 feet prior 1110   flood areas no platting shall take place within the floodway district of the city as delineated in the city floodplain overlay district within practical limits all lands of a subdivision living within the floodway shall be dedicated to the public prior 1111   sidewalks a before the city treasurer signs any plat or certified survey the subdivider shall list or show on the plat or certified survey the streets along which sidewalks are to be constructed pursuant to or 36117e such sidewalk placement is to be determined based on approved neighborhood plans for the area b sidewalks listed or shown on plats or certified surveys may be constructed by the subdivider or by the owner of the property if so constructed sidewalks shall comply with the standards set forth in  c when 80 percent or more of the lots included in the certified survey have been developed or when 80 percent or more of the lots along any street in one block have been developed the city engineer shall place all the lots in the certified survey or all the lots along the one block of the street on the next occurring public works program for construction of any required sidewalk not yet constructed but only if such proposed sidewalk would connect to an existing sidewalk unless pedestrian generators and destinations are both present in a localized area the order for and cost of such construction shall be as provided for in wis stats   as from time to time amended if any such sidewalk is placed on a city council agenda and is defeated then the administration shall not place such sidewalk on a city council agenda for the following two years  secs 3622436254  reserved article ix  public sites and open spaces generally a every owner of land who desires to subdivide such land shall be required to provide land to the city for public sites and open spaces or money in lieu of such land if the master plan master neighborhood plan or official map indicates that public land other than for streets or greenbelts is proposed for the land within the subdivision the owner shall dedicate such land to the city the city shall not reimburse the owner for any land so dedicated unless such dedication is for more than five percent of the total plat area if such required dedication is less than five percent of the total plat area the owner shall pay to the city a sum of money equal to five percent of the value of the total plat area less any land so dedicated the city may accept in lieu of such sum of money land within the subdivision of equal value b subdividers who desire approval of a certified survey may be required to dedicate as set out in a of this section c any funds received by the city under this section shall be spent by the city solely for improvements in acquisition of changes or additions to public park lands neighborhood parks or greenbelts in the area of the subdivision or in a community or regional city park wheresoever located any land accepted in lieu of such monies under this section may be sold by the city and monies therefrom shall be spent by the city for improvements in acquisition of changes or additions to any public park lands neighborhood parks or greenbelts in the area of the subdivision or in a community or regional city park wheresoever located  secs 3625636273  reserved article x  streets requirements generally the streets shall be designated and located in relation to existing and planned streets to topographical conditions and natural terrain features such as streams and existing tree growth to public convenience and safety and in their appropriate relation to the proposed uses of the land to be served by such streets prior 061   conformance the arrangement width grade and location of all streets shall conform to the master neighborhood plans official sidewalk plans official maps and janesville area long range transportation plan of the city  janesville area long range transportation plan  conformance the rightofway width of all proposed streets shall conform to the adopted janesville area long range transportation plan 1 major streets shall be properly integrated with the existing and proposed system of major streets and highways 2 collector streets shall be properly related to the mass transit system to special traffic generating from facilities such as schools churches and shopping centers to population densities and to major streets into which they feed 3 minor streets shall be laid out to conform as much as possible to topography to discourage use by to permit efficient drainage and sewer systems and to require the minimum amount of street necessary to provide convenient safe access to property prior 063   frontage roads where a subdivision borders on or contains a railroad rightofway or limited access highway rightofway the plan commission may require a 50footwide street parallel to and on either or both sides of such rightofway for purposes of conveying traffic between individual driveways and designated access points to the highway prior 064   major streets where a subdivision borders on or contains an existing or proposed major street the plan commission may require that frontage roads be provided prior 065   rightofway width requirements the rightofway and road way of all streets shall be of the width specified in the janesville area long range transportation plan on the official map or master plan or if no width is specified in the janesville area long range transportation plan on the official map or master plan they shall be not less than the width specified below 1 primary and standard arterials 100 feet  2 collector streets 80 feet  3 minor and local streets 70 feet except that rightofway widths of 60 feet may be permitted when recommended by the city engineer and approved by the plan commission  4 alleys 30 feet  5 frontage roads 30 feet prior 066   street width applications a streets having widths of 28 feet measured from face of curb to face of curb may be approved as determined appropriate by the city engineer parking should be restricted on one side of the street and designated at the time of preliminary plat approval b street widths less than 28 feet measured from face of curb to face of curb may be permitted when recommended by city engineering and approved by the plan commission if onstreet parking is restricted access is limited and physical or topographic constraints make such a lesser width appropriate  grades established grades shall be established by the city engineer the grade of major and collector streets shall not exceed six percent and the grade of all other streets shall not exceed 12 percent the minimum grade of all streets shall be fourtenths percent the standards in this section may be varied when necessitated by exceptional topography when the variation is approved by the city plan commission prior 067   horizontal curves the minimum radii or curvature on the centerline shall be not less than the following unless necessitated by unusual or special conditions subject to the approval of the city engineer 1 arterial streets 350 feet  2 collector streets 200 feet  3 minor streets 150 feet prior 068   vertical curves all changes in street grades shall be connected by vertical curves the length and elevations of such vertical curves shall be determined by the city engineer prior 069   tangents a tangent at least 100 feet long shall be introduced between reverse curves on major streets and 25 feet on minor streets and at all block corners where there is a deflection angle of more than ten degrees in the alignment of a street a curve shall be introduced with the required radius prior 0610   names a all dedication for street purposes shall bear a street name approved by the city plan commission and city council b street names within the jurisdictional limits of the city shall not duplicate or sound similar to existing street names c no new street name may be used to honor any living person d existing street names shall be projected wherever possible prior 0611     1975 culdesacs a the use of culdesacs will not be allowed unless the plan commission grants special permission and finds that due to unusual shape size location or topography the development may be better served by culdesacs than by continuous streets b culdesacs shall be no longer than 600 feet the radius of the rightofway of the end of a culdesac shall be at least 60 feet prior 0612   reserve strips reserve strips controlling access to streets and public property shall be prohibited except where their control is definitely placed in the city under conditions approved by the plan commission prior 0613   half streets half streets shall not be permitted where a half street is proposed by the subdivider the other half of the street shall be dedicated by the subdivider or adjacent owner prior 0614   intersectionsright angles required streets shall intersect as nearly as possible at right angles the block angle shall not be less than 75 degrees and not more than two streets shall intersect at any one point prior 071   intersectionsspecial conditions property lines at street intersections shall be rounded only on special conditions and where the plan commission considers it necessary such special conditions shall be when streets intersect at an acute angle of 85 degrees or less and the radii of such special curves shall be of such length as required by the city engineer street curb intersections shall be rounded by radii of 20 feet or more as required by the city engineer prior 072   street jogs not permitted when street jogs with centerline offsets of less than 125 feet shall not be permitted where streets intersect major streets their alignment shall be continuous prior 073   secs 3629236315  reserved article xi  storm sewers construction fees a it is found and declared that division and subdivision of land in the city has necessitated and will necessitate the construction of storm sewers to transport stormwater and other surface runoff  requires construction of increasingly larger trunks as runoff is collected from various areas and brought together to be disposed of  that such a plan requires construction in areas removed from the immediate land being divided and served by the storm sewer  that the benefit to each division of land is substantially equal no matter where on the storm sewer system that land happens to exist  that this required construction is specifically and uniquely attributable to the activities of subdividers  that the ordinance codified in this section is enacted in order to facilitate adequate provision for the transportation of this water  that storm sewers are necessary to the public health safety and welfare  that the cost for storm sewers is one that should be borne by those that create the need for the storm sewers  and that the necessity in the public interest for the provisions enacted in this section is declared as a matter of legislative determination b 1 at the time any plat certified survey or other subdivision is presented for approval or at the time a building permit is requested for any parcel that has not paid storm sewer assessment other than for those areas specifically defined or designated elsewhere in this article the developer shall deposit with the city clerktreasurer a sum of money to be used to pay for the design and construction of storm sewers and storm drainage improvements except as set forth elsewhere in this article the city shall charge and developers shall pay to the city for the design and construction of storm sewers and storm drainage improvements per acre the charge shall be in an amount as established by the city council from time to time and as set out in the fee schedule that appears in this such money shall be spent for any purpose except to pay for the design and construction of storm sewers and storm drainage improvements the total cost shall be computed by multiplying the cost per acre by the total number of acres included in the plat certified survey or other subdivision the assessment rate will be evaluated annually and a new rate established each year to assure recovery of not less than 100 percent of the cost of storm sewer design and construction the city council shall be advised of the new rate and the city council hereby authorizes the adjustment and assessment of such rates 2 a the northeast drainage basin is a specifically defined area northeast of and including part of the city of janesville that due to unique topographic drainage and related characteristics and factors requires a large 60acre drainage pond and related extensive and expensive stormwater drainage and sewer work specific to that area and not typical for other areas in and immediately surrounding the city at this time the northeast drainage basin is defined in b2b of this section at the time any plat certified survey or other subdivision is presented for approval or at the time a building permit is requested for any parcel in the northeast drainage basin the developer shall deposit with the city clerk a sum of money to be used to pay for the design and construction of storm sewers and storm drainage improvements in the northeast drainage basin for this specifically defined area the city shall charge and developers shall pay to the city an amount as established by the city council from time to time and as set out in the fee schedule that appears in this acre to be used to pay for the design and construction of storm sewers and storm drainage improvements therein no such money shall be spent for any purpose except to pay for the design and construction of storm sewers and storm drainage improvements the total cost shall be computed by multiplying the cost per acre by the total number of acres included in the plat certified survey or other subdivision the assessment rate will be evaluated annually and a new rate established each year to ensure recovery of not less than 100 percent of the cost of storm sewer design and construction the city council shall be advised of the new rate and the city council hereby authorizes the adjustment and assessment of such rates b the term northeast drainage basin means and includes the following areas set forth in the attached map labeled exhibit a which map is incorporated herein as if fully set forth verbatim c such deposit shall be made before the involved plat certified survey or other subdivision will be approved by the city d waiver procedure for storm sewer and stormwater facility charges 1 the city council may following recommendation by the plan commission accept and approve a waiver of assessment procedure for the cost of storm sewer and stormwater facilities for a particular subdivision plat or certified survey in lieu of a cash payment at the time of land division approval ref  this requires that each individual situation be examined upon its own merits as to whether or not such privilege is in the citys best interest 2 the waiver of special assessment procedure must be requested by the owner subdivider or developer in writing at least 14 days prior to the scheduled council meeting at which the final plat certified survey or land division is to be approved 3 upon request for the waiver procedure the staff shall calculate the total cost of the storm sewer and stormwater charges according to the prevailing rate per acre this total charge shall be divided equally to each parcel or lot in the subdivision or certified survey or shall be divided according to parcel area if appropriate because of oversized lots or large sites the waiver document shall be prepared listing both the total cost and the individual lot or parcel cost 4 the owner of each parcel so affected by the storm sewer and stormwater charges shall sign the waiver document which shall be properly notarized as called for in the document one hundred percent of the individual owners and developer must sign the waiver document agreeing to the special assessments to be levied 5 the city council prior to approving the subdivision plat certified survey or land division should review the storm sewer and stormwater charges and determine whether or not they will require the cash deposit or allow the waiver procedure as requested if the council following recommendation of the plan commission allows the waiver procedure the subdivision plat certified survey or land division can be approved immediately following such approval the council shall approve the waiver of assessment procedure thereby levying the special assessments for storm sewer as listed thereon 6 those lands which fall outside or beyond the provisions of said establishing storm sewer charges are subject to the charges at the same rate per acre to be levied in accordance with wis stats  6660 7 exception an exception to this policy may be made relative to the proposed charges rates and waiver procedure when in the judgement of the council there will be a substantial economic gain to the city c no charge shall be made for any plat certified survey or other subdivision which receives no benefit whatsoever from storm sewers paid for by such deposits d the plan commission shall be the agency which shall review any initial determination made pursuant to this section d this article shall take effect upon adoption the public health welfare and good order so requiring  secs 3631736335  reserved article xii  sidewalks construction  new installation a it is found and declared that division and subdivision of land in the city has necessitated and will continue to necessitate and construction installation maintenance and use of sidewalks to provide the safe effective and appropriate movement of pedestrians including but not limited to the elderly children persons with special physical attributes as well as residents and property owners of all kinds and nature  that the safe movement of vehicular traffic requires the installation and maintenance of sidewalks  that new areas of development provide the most efficient effective and low cost means for installation  that the city has adopted a comprehensive plan and one or more other policies providing for sidewalk installation  that such plans require construction of sidewalks in new development areas occasionally in areas removed from improved properties  that the ordinance codified in this section is enacted in order to facilitate the legitimate and pressing health welfare and safety of pedestrian and vehicular needs and responsibilities of the city  that sidewalks are necessary and beneficial to the health welfare and safety of the city its residents and general public  and the necessity in the public interest for the provisions enacted in this article is declared a matter of legislative determination b the plan commission shall be the agency which shall review any initial determination made pursuant to this article c the city engineer shall consistent with wisconsin statutes and without the necessity for additional action by the city council order andor cause the installationconstruction of sidewalks within 12 months of issuance of occupancy permit or in the event that 80 percent or more of an existing or future subdivision tract plat survey or area becomes developed whichever occurs first nothing herein shall be construed as prohibiting any individual property owner from requesting or effectuating installation of a sidewalk in front of such owners property d notwithstanding any provision to the contrary in this article each and every property owner shall comply with each and every other code provision pertaining to sidewalks including but not limited to maintenance and sidewalk installation e any plat certified survey or other division of land presented to the city for approval and as a condition of approval shall be required to contain and construct sidewalks on both sides of each street including culdesacs set forth in and applied to all areas of the proposed plat certified survey or other land division sidewalk installation on both sides of the street in all new subdivisions is subject to the following conditions 1 where an existing street ends at midblock with no existing or designated sidewalks and a certified survey map or plat is proposed to extend that street no sidewalk shall be required for said new street portion to block corner unless authorized by the city council 2 the city council may modify this section where the sidewalk placement is not physically practical  secs 3633736360  reserved article xiii  street lighting construction  new installation  cost satisfaction by subdivider a it is found and declared that division and subdivision of land in the city has necessitated and will continue to necessitate the construction installation maintenance and use of street lights to facilitate traffic flow pedestrian safety and property security  that this required installation of new street lights is specifically uniquely fairly and appropriately attributable in necessity and cost to the activities of subdividers  that the ordinance codified in this section is enacted in order to facilitate the legitimate and pressing health welfare and safety of citizens and responsibilities of the city  that street lights are necessary and beneficial to the health welfare and safety of the city its residents and the general public  that the cost of initial street lighting is one that should be borne by those who create the need for the subdivision andor land use  and the necessity in the public interest for the provisions enacted in this article is declared a matter of legislative determination b the plan commission shall be the agency which shall review any initial determination made pursuant to this article c new streetlight installations under this article shall be constructed as is customary for public works projects of this kind in accordance with applicable law  secs 3636236380  reserved article xiv  monuments requirement generally the subdivision shall be monumented as required by wis stats  23615 which is adopted by reference prior 14   secs 3638236405  reserved article xv  variances generally when in the judgment of the plan commission or the city council it would be inappropriate to apply literally a provision of this article because the subdivision is located outside the corporate limits or because extraordinary hardships would result it may waive or vary such provisions so that substantial justice may be done and the public interest secured provided that in no event shall the requirement of filing and recording the plat or survey maps be waived prior 18   planned developments proposed developments that require major variances from these standards shall be submitted as planned developments prior 19   secs 3640836427  reserved article xvi  violations penalty any person firm or corporation who fails to comply with the provisions of this chapter shall upon conviction thereof forfeit not less than $2500 nor more than $20000 and the costs of prosecution for each violation and in default of payment of such forfeiture and costs shall be imprisoned in the county jail until payment thereof but not exceeding 30 days each day a violation exists or continues constitutes a separate offense in addition the remedies provided by wis stats  23630 and 236312 shall be available to the city prior 21   traffic and vehicles footnotes  1  state law reference vehicles and traffic generally wis stats chs 340350  powers of local authorities wis stats ch 349  authority of local authorities to adopt traffic regulations in conformity with state law wis stats  34906 et seq article i  in general state traffic laws adopted except as prohibited by law all provisions of wis stats chs 340348 inclusive describing and defining regulations and procedures with respect to vehicles and traffic are adopted and by reference made a part of this chapter as if fully set forth any act required to be performed or prohibited by any statute so incorporated by reference is required or prohibited by this chapter any future amendments revisions or modifications of the statutes incorporated by this chapter are also adopted and incorporated in order to secure uniform statewide regulation of traffic in wisconsin   part 1982 wisconsin administrative except as prohibited by law all provisions of the wisconsin administrative defining regulations and procedures with respect to vehicles and traffic are adopted and by reference made a part of this chapter as if fully set forth any act required to be performed or prohibited by the wisconsin administrative incorporated by reference is required or prohibited by this chapter any future amendments revisions or modifications of the provisions incorporated by this chapter are also adopted and incorporated in order to secure uniform statewide regulation of traffic in wisconsin   part 1982 violation  penalty the penalty for violating shall be a forfeiture as provided in the applicable penalty provisions of chapters 340348 of the wisconsin statutes wis stats chs 340348 together with the costs and disbursements of the action in default of payment the violator shall be imprisoned according to the applicable provisions of wis stats chs 340348 but for not less than five days   part 1982 secs 3843824  reserved article ii  definitions generally in this chapter the following words terms and phrases shall have the meaning designated in this chapter unless a different meaning is expressly provided or the context clearly indicates a different meaning   part 1983 bus loading zone bus loading zone means the area adjacent to the curbline of any street in which no person shall park stop or leave standing any vehicle except a motor bus as defined by wisconsin statutes such bus loading zone shall be indicated by official traffic signs or markers stating bus loading zone or bus stop   part 1983 leased parking leased parking means a parking stall or area that is leased from the city to a specific individual or business and which entitles such individual or business to exclusive use of such stall or area at all times during the term of the lease   part 1983 loading zone loading zone means the area adjacent to the curbline of any street in which no person shall park stop or leave standing any vehicle for any purpose or length of time unless actually engaged in unloading and delivery or receipt and loading of merchandise material or passengers   part 1983 official traffic signs or markers official traffic signs or markers means all signs signals markings and devices placed or erected by authority of the public body having jurisdiction for the purpose of regulating traffic or parking a curb painted yellow whether solidly or intermittently shall be considered an official marker indicating that the parking of vehicles is prohibited in the street immediately adjacent to such painted curb   part 1983 parallel parking parallel parking means a method of parking in which a vehicle shall be parked facing in the direction of traffic with the wheels that are nearest the curb or edge of the street within 12 inches of such curb or edge of the street the vehicle shall be parked at least two feet from the nearest vehicle unless a different parking space or system of parallel parking is clearly indicated   part 1983 secs 38313848  reserved article iii  city manager authority purpose to promote the public safety and general welfare and to provide more flexibility in the use of public streets and public parking lots and to increase speed of adaption to changing conditions and to decrease the cost of publishing ordinances this delegation of authority as set out in this article has been established for the purpose of utilizing the authority which may be delegated by the city council pursuant to of the wisconsin statutes wis stats ch 349   part 1983 delegation of duties to city manager the city council delegates to the city manager or his or her designee such authority as may be delegated by of the wisconsin statutes wis stats ch 349 to control the public streets and parking lots of the city and to establish alter or repeal rules and regulations concerning such areas no such rule or regulation shall be made in contravention of any ordinance and in case of conflict between any such rule or regulation and an ordinance the ordinance shall control no rule or regulation shall be adopted pursuant to this section until the city manager or his or her designee has first consulted with the director of public works the chief of police and the city engineer no rule or regulation adopted pursuant to this section shall be effective unless official traffic signs or markers have been placed or erected indicating the particular prohibition limitation or restriction a list of all current rules and regulations adopted pursuant to this section shall be kept on file in the city engineers office and shall be open to public inspection during regular office hours  designation of areas pursuant to the authority delegated to the city manager in this article the city manager shall designate and cause to be appropriately signed the areas on the streets and in public parking lots with specific time limitations the areas reserved for leased parking and the areas in which specific rules or regulations apply including but not limited to bus loading zones handicapped parking areas loading zones and no parking areas   part 1983 leased parking fees the city manager shall provide for leasing stalls in leased parking areas the fee for a leased stall may vary depending upon the location of such stall the fee for a leased stall shall be established by the city manager as part of the rules and regulations   part 1983 temporary parking regulation the city manager or the chief of police is authorized to make temporary parking regulations to provide for unusual conditions or to test the feasibility of such regulations no such temporary parking regulations shall be valid unless such regulations have been reviewed by the city engineer and the area affected is posted with official traffic signs or markers no such temporary parking regulations shall remain in effect for more than 90 days a list of such regulations shall be placed on file in the city engineers office and shall be open to public inspection during regular office hours   part 1983 secs 38543879  reserved article iv  through highways footnotes  2  state law reference for statutory provisions authorizing local
